1213132.content:
Vanguard decided to head to Fiery Dragon, the tavern known for serving the spiciest food in all of Big Fat Pig City. After arriving at Fiery Dragon, Vanguard pondered how he should test the Glutton charm.

How should I test this charm. I could use it to eat a very spicy dish, However, let's test this thing for real. the Fiery Dragon is notorious for their Scorcher Challenge. If this Glutton Charm is able to stand up to the Scorcher Challenge not only can I get a free meal, but a prize of 10,000 gold.

Vanguard walks up to the counter.

"Hello sir. What would you like to order?" a serving wench asked.

"I would like to take on the Scorcher Challenge," Vanguard said.

The wench's eyes widen. "Are you sure about that sir? The only person who has taken on the Scorcher Challenge is the Tyrant! Such a feat is almost impossible for an ordinary man," the wench said.

"We'll have to see about that," Vanguard said.

The serving wench sighs. "If you insist sir, but be warned. Many have failed at completing the Scorcher Challenge. If you fail to complete the Scorcher Challenge you will have to pay 1000 gold."

The serving wench guided Vanguard to a large table. After Vanguard took his seat he slipped on the Glutton Charm. Within a matter of seconds a few chefs brought out the spiciest dishes that Vanguard saw. The whole spread was probably somewhere between 5-10 pounds altogether.

"You have fifteen minutes to eat everything on the table. If you complete the challenge in fifteen minutes your meal is free and you will receive 10,000 gold as a prize. Do you understand?" the wench asked.

"I do," Vanguard said.

Before the wench could tip over the hour glass Vanguard began chowing down. Vanguard consumed his food like he hadn't eaten in days. Thirteen minutes later Vanguard finished the Scorcher Challenge. The crowd around the table were surprised that someone other than the Tyrant was able to complete the Scorcher Challenge.

"Congratulations sir. As promised your meal is free and you get 10,000 gold," the wench said.

The owner of the Fiery Dragon hands Vanguard his gold.

"Congratulations sir. If there's men like you who could take down my spiciest dishes I may have to think of a new challenge."

"If the day comes I'll be ready," Vanguard said.

Vanguard test his chestful of 10,000 gold and proceeds to exit the Fiery Dragon. Before he got to the door he was stopped by a woman wearing a red cape.

"Hold on a moment, sir. Is that a magical charm around your neck? To the common people they won't know the difference between a necklace and a magic charm. Using magic items to win competitions is kind of shallow."

"I recently got this charm for saving a caravan mistress. I was just testing to see how it works," Vanguard said.

The woman puts to fingers on her chin in contemplation. "By the look of things you have very little exposure to magic. Some people can get addicted to the stuff if it's not used in moderation. That charm you have won't cause magical weight gain, but the food you consume while wearing it can. And to make matters worse the weight gain is all natural. But who am I to judge. I recently moved to this city, but it's obvious that this Tyrant person is a dragon."

Vanguard blinks in confusion. "How do you know that the Tyrant is a dragon?"

"Let's just say I've traveled to a lot of places. Your town has all the hallmarks of being taken over by a dragon. See you later."

The woman walks out of the Fiery Dragon leaving Vanguard confused.

Who was that woman? It's probably not worth over thinking. I have to get home and take off this charm. Once I take it off I'll be feeling everything that I ate and more.
1213132.title: Testing out the Glutton Charm

12131323.content:
In the morning, Vanguard found out that he was paying the price for using the charm; for one, he was dealing with bloat, and then there was the heartburn, and he found out that he was going to need to pay the Plumbers' Guild for a new toilet.

He managed to make it to the Station, where it seemed that everyone, including the people that they were dragging in, had heard about him beating the Scorcher Challenge, and were congratulating him, including the multiple murderer being dragged off to visit the Hangman. Still, Vanguard didn't feel very cheerful, especially when he heard the Commander yell out for him.

He managed to make it to the Commander's office, where he saw the Commander looking at a sheet of paper.

"I hear you bested the Fiery Dragon's Scorcher Challenge," said Rutabaga. "I'm guessing that it has something to do with the charm you were given yesterday."

Vanguard took the charm out, and placed it on the desk.

Rutabaga picked it up, and looked at it. "So, this thing let you beat that challenge, and thus you are 10,000 gold richer."

"Well, I'm going to need some of it to replace my toilet, and take care of some needed repairs around my home," said Vanguard.

"Yes, which is why I suggest that you donate most of your prize money to the Widows and Orphans Fund we have set up," said Rutabaga. "The Head Thief of the Thieves' Guild said that, since you won ten thousand in gold, you owe them a fee for Protection, and they want a thousand in gold. I told them that since you won the gold while on duty, said gold belongs to the Guard, and we've already paid our fee."

Vanguard sighed. "So, I don't even get to enjoy the money."

"You'll get to keep four thousand in gold, enough for your repairs, buy some nice clothes, and some fun," said Rutabaga. "Also, if Head Plumber tries to rip you off, do tell him that we know about his son's late night activities, and the Thieves' Guild would be interested in locating the fella who has been Illegally Breaking and Entering, for the purposes of messing with folks' plumbing, which is why the Plumber's Guild has been getting quite a lot of business. Granted, the Thieves' Guild could care less about the plumbing issues, but they don't like people breaking into places without a licence; the last fella they caught doing that ended up taking a job as a Royal Eunuch, which isn't really a job, as the Tyrant doesn't have a Harem of scantly clad women."

"Speaking of the Tyrant, someone told me that they believed that the Tyrant was a dragon," said Vanguard.

Rutabaga barked out a laugh. "The Tyrant, a dragon! Good one!" He then calmed down. "The Tyrant is far worse than that; he's a Human."

"Seriously?" Vanguard asked.

"That being said, the dragon clans will be coming here to bestow the title of Honorary Dragon upon him, which will give him high enough standing to talk to the Head Dragons, without the necessity of him talking to a lesser-ranked dragon first, just to work out some petty trade deal over coal, let alone something more important, like traveling through the Burning Lands to get spices," said Rutabaga.

"I see," said Vanguard. "And I take it that we'll be stepping up on security measures."

"Yes, the Thieves' Guild, the Assassins' Guild, the Magics' Guild, and the Guard will all be working together on this one," said Rutabaga. "We want no mistakes."

"I see," said Vanguard. He looked at the charm. "Do you want me to leave that here?"

"I recommend that you do, but I won't make you," said Rutabaga. "Of course, in light of this meeting, it is recommended to partner up with someone from one of the other groups. Your choices are Assassin Tetra Odon Tides, Thief Snatchem Grabum, and Mage Toooldforthis Taugh."

"And what do they do?" Vanguard asked.

"Tetra specializes in poison, especially when it's added to food, but she's good with knives as well," said Vanguard. "Thirty kills, and only one failure."

Vanguard looked at Rutabaga. "I'm going to guess that the one failure was you."

Rutabaga grinned. "Word of caution; make sure to search her hair when she lets it down - she carries a second hairpin, which has a needle laced with tetrodotoxin, which makes it really difficult to breath. Of course, dwarf cooking helps out with one there - dwarves make food out of anything, including poisonous fish."

"I see," said Vanguard. "And the others?"

"Snatchem specializes in stealth, and can rob you blind before you even know he's in the room," said Rutabaga. "He has stolen a hundred thousand gold worth of money, valuables, and items, plus Lord Thoroughbred's Prized Racing Stallion."

"That's one fast horse," said Vanguard. "I hear he's not allowed to race anymore."

"Yes, because he was such a sure thing to win, folks started placing bets on who would come in Second," said Rutabaga. "Now, as for Toooldforthis, he recently graduated from his classes, and is now a full-fledged wizard. Very smart, very skilled, thirty years old, but he looks like he's seventy due to a classmate's prank that went wrong, plus all the other issues that comes with being that old, but has stopped a few demons from wrecking the Guild whenever someone messes up a spell."

"This guy looks seventy, but is actually thirty?" Vanguard asked.

"The prankster had it worse," said Rutabaga. "His entire lifeforce, including everything he knew, was added to Toooldforthis's. Magic isn't kind to those who fail."

"I see," said Vanguard.

"Consider it a warning, if you use that charm," said Rutabaga. "Now, let me know your pick, so that I can tell their respective Masters."
12131323.title: The Next Day, the Commander asks to see Vanguard

choices: On the way to Town Square Vanguard runs into the mystery woman from last night
121313233.content:
"I'll partner up with Toooldforthis Taugh. Since we'll be travelling to the Burning Lands it is best to have an expert in magic as a partner. I don't trust the other two. Tetra Odon Tides would probably try to kill me with a kiss or some other absurd feminine wile trick and Snatchem would rob me of the rest of the gold that I won," Vanguard said.

"I thought you would choose Toooldforthis Taugh. Don't worry about Tetra Odon Tides or Snatchem. I'll be partnering up with Lady Tides and our newest guard will be keeping her eye on Snatchem," Rutabaga said. Rutabaga hands Vanguard a map.

"You'll need this map. I'm going to inform Evelyn Sortcastdon that you'll be going with Toooldforthis. See you in an hour."

Rutabaga walks off in the direction of the Magic Guild. Meanwhile Vanguard took a look at his map.

"Looks like it will be a four day journey. I better prepare my gear."

As Vanguard was walking home to prepare his things he heard someone calling out to him.

"Pardon me good sir. Are you Vanguard Stonewell?" An elderly man asked.

"I am. What may I help you with?"

The elderly man starts laughing. "The name's Toooldforthis Taugh. I'm your partner for this mission."

Vanguard takes a double take of Toooldforthis. Before him he saw a bearded elderly man leaning on what looks like a magical staff. Toooldforthis was wearing a blue cloak and had a few potions on hand.

"It's nice to meet you, Toooldforthis," Vanguard said.

"Likewise Vanguard. Did you know that on the way to the Burning Lands there's a special place called Wishing Forest?"

"Wishing Forest?" Vanguard asked.

"Yes, Wishing Forest. It is said that the forest contain powerful magic. Hopefully while we're there I can use this magic to return to my youthful self once more. It isn't easy being a thirty year old with the body of an old man. Every day my bones ache and I have a terrible coughing fit. I usually got to take potions to deal with those hassles. Once I'm young again I can ditch these potions," Toooldforthis said referring to the potions on the inside of his cloak.

"I see. So you volunteered for this mission in order to restore your youth. That's understandable. I just have to pack a few things and then I'll meet up with you in town square."

"Okay. See you then."
121313233.title: Mage Toooldforthis Taugh

1213132333.content:
A while later, Vanguard was on a horse, and was finding out that he needed a lot more practice with being in the saddle. Next thing he knew, he'd fallen off, for at least the third time.

He looked up to see the Commander looking down at him, and grinning.

"I told you, lean forward when we go uphill, and lean backward when we go down."

"I was," said Vanguard.

Rutabaga got off his horse, and carefully helped Vanguard back on his. "Yes, and then the ground straightened out, but you were still leaning, and thus were off-balance."

There was some chuckling, and Vanguard looked, to see Snatchem riding a very expensive horse. "What do you know about horse-riding, Thief?"

Snatchem grinned. "Enough to steal them. And enough not to fall off."

"Did you steal that one?" Rutabaga asked, as he got on his own horse.

Snatchem gave his horse an affectionate pat by its shoulder. "Previous owner didn't take very good care of him, and forgot to pay his Protection Fees. The horse more than covered said fees. Of course, when Head Thief saw just how badly treated this horse had been, he threatened to go the Horse Guild, and you know how they are about folks who mistreat their animals."

"I remember the one from last year," said Rutabaga. "Guy was dragged by his own horse, and suffered several broken bones. His left arm is still messed up, despite the Healers' best efforts, to say nothing about how his fingers were stepped on."

"Very protective," said the figure riding behind the rest of the group. "They want horses, and other animals to have their own rights."

Vanguard looked at the man; there was a lot about him that he didn't like. He felt like drawing his sword and running him through, but the man gave him a look that gave him second thoughts. Even the cloth-covered assassin Tetra didn't bother him as much.

"Might prove useful," said Rutabaga. "Take animals away from bad owners, and give them to good owners."

The man grinned. "Good one, Commander."

"Why does he have to come with us?" Vanguard asked, quietly.

"Dragons won't meet us otherwise," said Rutabaga.

Vanguard watched, as the Commander nudged his horse a bit, causing it to move faster, and thus get alongside the new guard. Vanguard didn't know much about her, other than she'd joined earlier during the week, and, prior to last night, had gone by the name of John Smith, although it seemed her real name was Sally Butcher. She had short hair, and was small chested, plus somewhat slim, meaning some would have taken her for a teenage boy, but a werewolf's nose wasn't fooled easily, and after a private talk with the Commander, Sally had gone to the Quartermaster, and told him the truth, which was a relief for the old man - there was already ten John Smiths on the force, and finding out that one of them was really Sally Butcher made things easier for Pay Day.

Vanguard sighed, and looked at Toooldforthis, and saw that the mage had a wistful look on his face, as the old-looking man looked at the female guard.

"She'd never look at me," the mage muttered.

"What do you mean?" Vanguard asked.

Toooldforthis looked at him. "What?"

"You were looking at her," said Vanguard. "What do you mean she wouldn't look at you?"

"I look like her grandfather, that's why," said the mage.

"Doesn't stop certain older men from marrying younger women," said the figure behind them. "I've met up with plenty of people who have taken on wives that are half their age."

"Yes, but in those cases, the husbands are twice as old as their wives," the mage said.

"Yes, I've heard of your condition," the figure said. "Head Mage has told me about it - you look seventy because the one who pranked you was forty years old, and everything that was his, was added to you - age, knowledge, memories - makes one wonder what would happen if the spell was undone - would you really be thirty years old, or would you be two separate people?"

The mage looked forward.

Vanguard looked back at the figure. "Just why are you here?"

The figure grinned. "The dragon's wish to speak to me; can't do that if I'm the city, now can I, Mr. Vanguard Fisher Green?"

Vanguard looked forward. He hadn't told anyone about his middle name. He saw that the Commander had drifted back to him.

"How did you like chatting with the Tyrant?"

Vanguard looked back, and saw the Tyrant grin right at him. It was unsettling. "I'd hate to seriously anger him."

"I'd advise against it," said Rutabaga. "He might not look it, but he has personally killed thirty-seven Unlicensed Killers, who have tried to assassinate him - eight in one attempt, and that's not counting the Licensed Assassins, who got their arms or legs broke, as it doesn't pay to kill old classmates or fellow alumni who are just doing their job, to say nothing about the fifty-one kills he made as a Licensed Assassin, including the previous ruler, who had it coming."

"What did he do?" Vanguard asked.

Rutabaga looked at him. "Let's just say that he was a little too fond of children, even for most crime bosses' tastes."

"Why didn't you do the deed?" Vanguard asked.

Rutabaga grinned. "I did warn him to change his ways, or else no guards would be there to protect him during an attempt."

Vanguard looked back at the Tyrant, and then at Rutabaga. "You hired him to do the job, or told the guards to let him through?"

Rutabaga looked at him, in fake shock. "Do you know what trouble that would bring? The Commander hiring an Assassin to kill the Tyrant? Such scandal!" Then he grinned. "No, but it seems that there was a riot going on between the trolls and the dwarves, and the Guard had to go in and break it up. During which time, the old Tyrant was Assassinated. No connection between the riot and the Assassination was ever found, even when said theory was investigated."

"It's a fact that you are connected to figures in both the dwarf and troll communities; you could have set things up, meaning that he could have used the riot to his own means," said Vanguard.

"Possible, but that would require me knowing that there was a plot to assassinate the old Tyrant in advance," said Rutabaga. "Then again, lots of female Assassins have ended up in my bed, and it's possible someone dropped a few hints, which I might have used to my advantage."

"Still, you benefited from the assassination," said Vanguard.

Rutabaga grinned. "Everyone did. Still, I'm surprised he took the position himself, not that I'm complaining too much."

"Still, why didn't you take on the job?" Vanguard asked.

"I'm sure you've heard the rumor about my supposed Royal ancestry," said Rutabaga. "Folks would have pointed to it as the reason. That being said, I'd rather avoid running the city, and remain a guard."

"Okay," said Vanguard.

"Dust cloud up ahead," said Tetra.

"Let's see who it is," the Tyrant said.
1213132333.title: On the Road

choices: On the way to Wishing Forest a banshee attacks the group
After arriving in Wishing Forest the party sets up camp
The Backstory between the Tyrant of Big Fat Pig City and the Empress of Shinara
12131323331.content:
When the the dust cloud cleared Vanguard and the rest of the party saw that it was the dragons.

"Greetings Sir Tyrant and personnel. Before we can bestow upon you the title of Honorary Dragon you must complete three tasks," a red dragon said.

"What are these three tasks?" The Tyrant asked.

The red dragon grins. "Right to the point. Just how we dragons like it. You must first collect the rare Wish Leaves from the Wishing Forest. Next, you will gather mud from the Swamp of Peril. Lastly, you will need to find a Dragon Jewel. After you do these things our king will meet with you."

"Do you accept this challenge?" A green dragon asked.

"I do," the Tyrant said.

"Excellent. We will see you in the Burning Lands," a blue dragoness said.

With that the dragons took flight. Vanguard and his party watched in awe.

"What's up with dragons and quests? It's never that simple," Vanguard said.

"That's because dragons have a superiority complex. They liken themselves as gods due to their immortality. They say that some cultures do worship dragons," Rutabaga said.

"Dragons are also known to sometimes take human form. Or that's one of the first thing Evelyn taught us," Toooldforthis said.

"According to our map we should reach the Wishing Forest by nightfall," Sally Butcher said.

"We better get moving. The Empress from Shinara City often has her henchmen out at night. She and I have a somewhat checkered history," the Tyrant said.
12131323331.title: The Dragons

choices: They make it to Wishing Forest.
They take a wrong turn somewhere.
121313233313.content:
"So, just what is the deal between the Tyrant and the Empress?" Sally asked. "I know her representative was in town a few years ago, and placed in an order for two thousand head of cattle, only to cancel it that very night."

"How do you know that?" Vanguard asked.

"Does the name Butcher bring to mind someone who cleans floors, or someone who slaughters livestock for a living?" Rutabaga asked. "The Empress of Shinara was planning to invade the area, and was going to use our own resources to support the invasion." He looked at Sally. "You were working in your father's shop that day?"

"Yes, cleaning the floors, when the representative talked to my father about making the purchase," said Sally. "He gave father a decent down-payment. Then, he later cancelled it, and tried to steal the money back, but father had already let the Thieves' Guild know about the money, plus paid his Protection Fee, and thus the representative got a few fingers broken for Attempted Unlicensed Theft of Money."

"I heard about that, on top of what all else happened," said Rutabaga. "He made it quite clear that Shinara was going to invade Big Fat Pig City, but at the meeting to try to get the city to surrender before the war, he made two mistakes; he insulted my father, who was there representing the Copperfindersson dwarf clan, and their relations, over the trade of silver through their lands, and my mother, who was representing the Stoon werewolf pack, and their allies, in trying to either ban or regulate the trade of silver through their lands, and the Shinara representative said that dwarves were rock-loving idiots and werewolves were nothing but mangy fleabags. Both mistakes landed him in trouble with my parents."

"So, just what happened to him?" Vanguard asked.

"When you insult a dwarf, you'd better hope your head is harder than his," said Rutabaga. "As for insulting a werewolf, you'd better be able to outrun them."

"What happened?" Sally asked.

"He was forced to run out of town with a good sized headache," the Tyrant said. "Naked."

"Explains a few things," said Sally.

"Yes, and the Empress said that we had insulted her representative," said the Tyrant. "I merely informed her that her representative insulted two of our most honored citizens. She took offence to that for some reason."

"I see," said Sally.

Vanguard had to chuckle, as did everyone else. Big Fat Pig City might have been a depraved city of scum, but it was their scum.
121313233313.title: The Backstory between the Tyrant and the Empress

choices: The commander and Tetra have returned, but Sally and Snatchem went missing
The rest were there, and so was someone else - Toooldforthis's former prankster.
1213132333132.content:
After traveling for a few hours Vanguard and his party finally make it to Wishing Forest. Before anyone could unpack anything Toooldforthis cast a spell that set up the camp itself. Vanguard and the others stared in awe at the mage.

"That was amazing!" Sally said.

"There's a reason why Toooldforthis graduated at the top of his class. With camp set up we best get some shut eye. Or at least I do. Let me know if anything happens," the Tyrant said.

The Tyrant then went inside an elaborate tent just him. Vanguard and the others stare at each other for a few moments.

"We best go on patrol and survey the area. Once everyone is done patrolling we'll take turns keeping watch," Rutabaga said.

Vanguard and his group then split up to patrol Wishing Forest. As Vanguard and Toooldforthis were walking they paused briefly to admire the greenery of Wishing Forest.

"So this is Wishing Forest. I've never seen so many magical plants gathered in one place in my life. I've read about how some of these plants have special properties," Toooldforthis said.

"Is that so? I had no idea," Vanguard said.

"While we're out on patrol, Vanguard, we should look for the Wishing Fairy. She's said to grant any wish."

"Wishing Fairy? So there's a fairy who lurks the forest granting people's wishes. Sorry to be a downer, but don't wishes go awry or something?"

"If granted by a djinn then yes. Wishes granted by the Wishing Fairy always come true, yet there aren't any recorded details on drawbacks though," Toooldforthis replied.

"Then let's find this Wishing Fairy. I have to see her in order to believe that she is who you say she is," Vanguard said.

Vanguard and Toooldforthis continue their patrol. Thirty minutes later they see a blonde haired woman wearing a dazzling blue dress. Both Vanguard and Toooldforthis stop dead in their tracks as the woman approaches them.

"I've heard that you two were looking for me," The woman said.

"Are you the Wishing Fairy?" Toooldforthis asked.

"That's right. I am here to grant you two your wishes. Be warned though. You only get one wish per person and the wishes cannot be reversed. Also I can't give you fame or fortune, but I can provide gifts that will aid in those endeavors," the Wishing Fairy said.

"So how would this work? Do we just tell you our wish or something?" Vanguard asked.

"That's not how the wishes I grant work," the Wishing Fairy said. The Wishing Fairy uses her magic to summon a chalice. "All you have to do is take a sip from this chalice and the your greatest desire shall come to pass."

"If that's all it takes then I'll just help myself," Toooldforthis said.

The Wishing Fairy hands Toooldforthis the chalice. Toooldforthis takes a sip and hands it back to the Wishing Fairy. At first nothing happens. Then all of a sudden Toooldforthis starts to physically grown younger until he looks his actual age.

"By the gods! It works! Not only do I look my age, but I feel more powerful too!"

Vanguard stood in awe as the now young looking Toooldforthis did a flip in the air.

"That's one wish granted. It's your turn," The Wishing Fairy said as she handed Vanguard the chalice.

Vanguard slowly takes the chalice and takes a sip. At first nothing happens. Then Vanguard bends over in pain. Toooldforthis watches as Vanguard grows three feet taller. As Vanguard grew taller his clothes ripped to shreds. After Vanguard stopped growing in height his muscles swelled to herculean proportions. Finally, Vanguard started putting on flab on top of his muscles until he was 500 lbs. fatter. After the wish was finished Vanguard stood up.

Vanguard was in shock over his transformation. Not only was he 9' 6", but he was stronger and fatter as well. Vanguard didn't even feel fatigued as he flexed his meaty arms.

"This is impossible. How could I be extremely strong and extremely fat and feel invigorated?"

"You had the desire to be the strongest and biggest man in your city. The chalice just simply brought your wish to the surface. I have to go. Farewell and may fate bring you blessings."

The Wishing Fairy disappears in a puff of smoke. Vanguard and Toooldforthis look at each other. Toooldforthis uses his magic to give Vanguard new clothes to fit his new body. They then resume their patrol. After their patrol they return to camp. However...
1213132333132.title: They make it to Wishing Forest.

12131323331323.content:
Vanguard watched as Toooldforthis paused, as they entered the camp. He looked and saw a woman wearing the outfit of a witch.

"Mavius Greycat?" Toooldforthis asked. "How is this possible? Wasn't everything that was you supposed to have been added to me?"

"You weren't the only one to have a wish; yours was for me to have my body back, mine was for you to have your age restored," the woman said. "We both got what we wanted."

At this, Toooldforthis rushed up to Mavius, grabbed her in a hug, and kissed her. "I've missed you for so long; I always wished that there was a way to bring you back."

"I'm sorry about that prank in class," Mavius said. "I just wanted to mess with you, not turn you into an old man for real."

"This is the one who turned you into an old man?" Vanguard asked.

Toooldforthis looked up at him, and chuckled. "Well, what do you expect for a husband-and-wife to do if they don't pull the occasional joke on each other?"

"There's always sex," said the Tyrant. "Less trouble with that."

"Not when you're in class," said Mavius. "Teachers complain." She then kissed her husband again.

Vanguard looked at Mavius, and looked at Toooldforthis. "Um, she's older than you, right?"

Toooldforthis grinned. "I always preferred older women; more experience."

Rutabaga chuckled at this. "Good one." He walked up to Vanguard, and looked at him. "I see you put on a growth spurt, and a bit of weight."

Vanguard chuckled nervously. "Yes, sir. I'm going to be the biggest, and strongest man in the Guard."

Rutabaga grabbed Vanguard by the shirt, and brought the big man's head down to the werewolf's level. "Don't let that muscle and fat all rush to your head; strength is nothing next to having the sense to know when, and how, to use it. A dwarf with an ax can still hack your legs off, and I wager that trolls and golems could still take you in a wrestling match, for they know how to use their strength. As for me, my jaws are still strong enough to crush your skull. So, don't get any funny ideas about trying to take the whole Guard on in a fight."

"I wasn't thinking of anything like what you might have been thinking I was thinking," said Vanguard. "I have nothing but the utmost respect for you, sir."

Rutabaga grinned, his teeth showing, some of them more pointed than normal. "I'll keep that in mind, when I write my evaluation on you; talk to me the next time you decide to drink some sort of magical concoction, or use some sort of magical charm."

Vanguard grinned nervously. "Yes, sir!"

Rutabaga let go of him. "I hope your body can walk at a horse's pace in the morning; you're too big to ride yours, and Mavius will be in need of it."

"I understand sir," said Vanguard. "I'm sorry for disappointing you."

"Just don't make me lose my respect for you," said Rutabaga. "You've been on the guard for a few years, so you've earned some leeway; if I caught Sally pulling the stunts you've pulled in the last few days, I'd strip her of her uniform, and toss her out of the Guard!" He looked at Sally, before looking back at Vanguard. "You must lead by example; act without discipline for yourself, and they too will not have discipline."

Vanguard gulped at this. "I'll keep that in mind, sir."

"Next time, inform me, so that I can at the very least give you some advice," said Rutabaga. "After all, the next concoction you drink might actually be poison, and that might kill you if you are not prepared."

"I understand, sir."

"Good," said Rutabaga. "You and me will take first watch. I think Toooldforthis and Mavius want to get reacquainted."

Vanguard looked, and saw as the mage and the witch went into a tent that was very different from the plainer tent it had once been. "I guess that would make sense."

"Yes," said Rutabaga. "Then, you can get some sleep, and Tetra will stand watch with me. Sally, Snatchem, you two get the last watch."

"And that leaves me to have a good night's sleep," said the Tyrant, as he got into his tent, as the others went to their own tents.

Rutabaga looked at Vanguard. "Do you think you can use your sword?"

Vanguard looked at his weapon, and chuckled nervously. "That is something Toooldforthis forgot to fix for me."

Rutabaga chuckled. "There's always clubs; trolls and the like use them, especially since it isn't too practical to make swords in their size. Cheaper to make as well."

"Yes sir."
12131323331323.title: Old Classmate, and Toooldforthis's Wife

choices: Late in the night Vanguard hears cries for help.
121313233313233.content:
It was another quiet night. Vanguard and Rutabaga sat by the campfire as they watched for any invaders who would wish to assassinate them or rob them of their possessions.

"Vanguard, it sure is peaceful tonight. We normally don't get many nights like these in Big Fat Pig City," Rutabaga said.

"That's true. I just hope I can put my newfound size and girth to good use. I wasn't expecting the Wishing Fairy's magic to be as potent as it was. Initially I was skeptical of her existence and intentions when Toooldforthis mentioned her. I was afraid that the wish would of went wrong," Vanguard said.

"So let me get this straight. You only drank whatever that fairy was offering after Toooldforthis did? You really need to learn to control your curiosity. There's an expression that says that curiosity killed the cat," Rutabaga replied.

"Will do sir. It's just that I have no idea of how powerful magic can be. When it comes to anything magical I have next to no experience on how to deal with it," Vanguard said.

"It doesn't surprise me. When I found you, you were an orphaned beggar stealing scraps from animals. A word of advice, the next time we go on missions like these make sure you visit the Library before hand. Size and strength can only get you so far. Having knowledge helps you in any situation," Rutabaga said.

Vanguard nods his head. "I see. I'll have to do that. Yet when I get home I may have to enter a few eating contests and wrestling tournaments in order to renovate my place for a person of my size"

"Do you plan on rebuilding your home yourself? I know that the Builders' Guild offers a huge discount for anyone that can build their own home."

"That's the plan. I built my first house. It shouldn't be that much of an issue," Vanguard said.

Rutabaga rolls his eyes. "Just don't let your ego cloud your judgement. Last last person who thought they were so great almost got their head chopped off by a Minotaur."

"I'll keep that in mind. Yet I might have to take up hunting and fishing to bring in enough food to feed myself," Vanguard said.

"Don't worry about it. We'll figure it out when we get their. Yet I don't think Big Fat Pig City has a Hunting and Wildlife Guild. Yet if you plan on starting a guild you'll need to be proficient at what you do and gather people who are interested in Hunting and Wildlife," Rutabaga said.

Vanguard looks at his boss in confusion. "I wasn't even considering on becoming a Guildmaster. I still got to figure out how I'm going to use my size efficiently."

Rutabaga chuckles. "I'm sure you'll learn quickly. There are a few towns leading to the Swamp of Peril. Also you'll learn as we continue this mission. You'll have plenty of chances to learn how to use your new size."
121313233313233.title: Just a Quiet Night

choices: The woman from the other night.
1213132333132333.content:
Just then, Rutabaga reached out to Vanguard, and shoved him backwards.

Vanguard gasped, as he saw a crossbow bolt piece the Commander's arm. "Sir! You've been hit!"

"Be glad it isn't your head!" Rutabaga growled out. Then, with a howl, he yelled out. "Ambush!"

Vanguard watched as the rest came out of their tents, including the Tyrant, who, unlike the rest, had no weapons, or obvious signs of being dangerous, beyond his looks.

"You alright Commander?" The Tyrant asked, coldly. "Need any help removing that bolt?"

Rutabaga snapped the bolt head off, and pulled the shaft out of his arm.

The Tyrant nodded. "I'll take that as you're alright."

"We have you surrounded and outnumbered," a voice called. "We see you have some magic users and a werewolf, and an ogre, Tyrant of Big Fat Pig City. We have powerful magic users ourselves."

"Not anyone any good," Toooldforthis muttered. "I can sense their power levels, which are rather low."

"To you, and your wife, perhaps," the Tyrant said. "The rest of us do not have magic." Then, he said, in a louder, yet calm, voice, "What do you want?"

"We want your money, and your weapons! We'll take the women as well!"

"That's not going to-" started Vanguard, until he was interrupted.

"Got a better offer," the Tyrant called out. "Take me as a hostage, and you can ransom me for a lot of money from Big Fat Pig City, or give me to my enemies for a lot of money! My request is that you don't harm those who are only here for protection."

The voice laughed. "Very well! We'll spare your protection if you come to us!"

The Tyrant walked into the woods, in the direction of the voice.

Vanguard tried to say something, only for Rutabaga to step on his foot.

"Get ready," the werewolf said.

Before Vanguard could ask, he heard a loud crack, along with a scream of pain.

"My arm! He broke my arm! Get him!"

*Snap!*

"My leg!" called out another voice.

"Should we help him?" Vanguard asked.

"He can take care of himself," said Rutabaga. "And turn around right now!"

Vanguard turned, and saw that a group of bandits had emerged from the forest, and were rushing to attack. He reached for his sword, only to realize it didn't fit his hand anymore. He was about to call out to Toooldfor this, when he saw that the mage and his wife were busy in a magic duel with ten others.

"Don't distract them!" came Rutabaga's voice. "Catch!"

Vanguard turned just in time to catch a central post from one of the tents. "How do I use this?"

Rutabaga stabbed an outlaw in the chest with his sword. "Bash them over the head! Very simple!"

"I need a new sword!" said Vanguard, as he swung the post.

"I'll talk to someone about it!" Rutabaga tore the throat out of another with his hand. "Sally! You alright!"

"She's fine!" came the voice of the cloth covered Tetra. "She might even live if she can get over the idea of killing someone, and actually kill them before they kill her!"

"Go help Sally," said Rutabaga. "I have this section covered."

Vanguard turned, and was about to go to Sally, when a sharp pain in his leg caused him to stumble. He looked at his leg, and saw the crossbow bolt. He looked up, and saw the owner having already reloaded his crossbow.

"Can't miss a big target like you."

Just then, a hand grabbed the bandit from behind, and Vanguard saw a blade burst from the man's chest.

"Could say the same about you," the other person said, as they shoved the body away.

Vanguard looked, and saw that his rescuer was....
1213132333132333.title: Bandits!

choices: The next morning the party continues their quest.
The next morning Rutabaga informs the party about Empress's goal to conquer the
12131323331323333.content:
Vanguard looked, and saw that his rescuer was the woman from the other night.

"You're that woman from the other night! How did you find us?" Vanguard asked the woman.

"I was just travelling back home. I see that you let your curiosity get the better of you. Wishing yourself larger is not how you achieve your goals. By the looks of things you barely know how to fight at your size. Now hold still while I take that bolt out of your leg."

The woman breaks the tip of the bolt. Vanguard winces in pain as she removes the rest of the bolt.

"With that done I'll cast a healing spell," the woman said.

The woman chants and casts a healing spell. Within seconds Vanguards leg is healed.

"Thank you," Vanguard said.

"Don't mention it. You would be dead if I didn't arrive to save you. With your inability to fight at your size you're more of a liability. Also, you should be wearing better armor. What you're wearing isn't going to work. A man your size needs to wearing something plated and flexible."

"Who are you? The way you talk reminds me of Rutabaga. You even criticize me like he does."

"I am Princess Veronica Crestshield of Everwood. You're Vanguard Evergreen from what I've heard. If you want to be more effective in battle you'll need training. Luckily for you Valaburg is next to the Swamp of Peril. The people there are large humans built very much like yourself."

"There's a city of humans that are as large as me?" Vanguard asked.

"That's correct. I'm close friends with the king of Valaburg. Since we are going in the same direction for now I'll travel with your group," Veronica said.

"Seems like our party is just getting bigger by the minute. Yet it's not everyday that a runaway princess saves the life of one of my guards."

Vanguard turns his head and sees Rutabaga leaning against a tree.

"The great Commander Rutabaga. It's an honor to meet you in person. I tried to find you the other night, but your Tyrant kept me from meeting you. He was keen on trying to flirt with me," Veronica said.

"You're not the first noblewoman he's tried that with. Most who refused his advances rarely lived to tell the tale. Yet most of those noblewomen were trained assassins hired to kill him, but that's beside the point," Rutabaga said.

"There's something I must discuss with you, but I need to do it privately. It has to do with my kingdom."

"Very well. Follow me to my tent. Oh and Vanguard, don't do anything foolish like licking a magic mushroom or talking to magical cats. Your lack of knowledge on all things magical nearly got you killed."

"Yes, sir," Vanguard replied.

With that Vanguard returned to camp and kept watch until the next shift.
12131323331323333.title: Princess Veronica Crestshield

choices: Veronica is trying to find an Alternative Wife for Gunter
121313233313233333.content:
Rutabaga and Veronica sat on some chairs. "Fisher Green; Vanguard Fisher Green is the guard's name."

"Shortened from Evergreen three generations back," Veronica said. "I make it my business to know those I deal with."

"I could say the same about you," said Rutabaga. "How's Aunt Verganda doing?"

Veronica sighed. "She's pressuring me to marry Prince Gunter of Valaburg."

Rutabaga nodded. "Mother always said she was difficult to please. Had to have everything just right for her wedding to Lord Fauna Flora Crestshield. Mother and father, they were fine with a simple ceremony from the All Gods temple, with the rest of the Guards in attendance, and their families."

"The problem is, I like Gunter, and he likes me, and well, maybe we've had the occasional stroll in the woods together, but, as for getting married, we'd be better off as friends," said Veronica.

"I know the feeling," said Rutabaga. "Mother wishes for me to get married, but she understands that I haven't found the right person. She also understands about me just having children with someone - don't want to do that if I don't care for the mother."

Veronica smiled. "Makes me wish we were siblings instead of cousins. Be easier to avoid her."

Rutabaga grinned. "Never was fond of Aunt Verganda myself. She never did like the fact that Mother married a dwarf."

"Uncle Turnip is a human," said Veronica.

"Only by blood," said Rutabaga. "He was raised a dwarf, taught dwarf customs, thinks dwarf, talks dwarf, knows his slate from shale, and is a dwarf as far as other dwarves are concerned. The fact that he's almost seven feet tall makes no difference to them, save for the fact that he has to walk on his knees when he's in a mine."

Veronica chuckled. "There is that point there. What do dwarves think about you?"

"They think I'm a dwarf who moonlights as a werewolf."

Veronica laughed at this. "At least they have a good sense of humor." She looked in the direction of the Tyrant's tent. "What about him? Why do you listen to him?"

"Because he's not as bad as some of the Tyrants we've had, and does a bit of good," said Rutabaga. "Also, it makes things easier as well."

"Better for you to be thought of as the sheepdog instead of as the shepherd?" Veronica asked.

"Something like that," said Rutabaga. "What about you? Why are you wandering about?"

"Negotiations with other kingdoms," said Veronica. "So, just what is your Tyrant really like?"

"Providing you don't try to kill him, you'd be alright with him," said Rutabaga. "He wouldn't force you into his bed, if that's what you mean. As for if you were an Assassin, and that's Assassin and not assassin, you'd probably just have your arm or leg broken."

Veronica grinned. "Like that would work."

"Yes, a magic-using werewolf would be a new one for him," said Rutabaga. "So, just why did you want to see me?"
121313233313233333.title: Rutabaga and Veronica Talk

choices: The young man tell Rutabaga all that he remembers
Rutabaga starts interrogating the young man
Vanguard goes back to his post.
1213132333132333332.content:
"I'm trying to find someone else for Gunter to marry. Someone who's naturally big."

"You mean like a giant or titan?" Rutabaga asked.

"Or someone who doesn't mind growing to huge proportions. Valaburg has an immigration vetting process that requires all citizens to be able to protect themselves. During this training process they undergo a strict training regimen and drink a growth tonic to ensure that they reach the average size and girth of a Valaburgian within a year or two," Veronica said.

"So you want me to help you find a Gunter a wife who is already naturally big and wouldn't mind adapting to the Valaburgian lifestyle. Wouldn't it be easier to find him a wife in Valaburg? It shouldn't be that difficult," Rutabaga said.

Veronica gasped. "Now that I think about it there Captain Cinderella Bloback of the Valaburgian army. Gunter always mentions her in a conversation. He describes her as the best knight in the Valaburgian army."

Veronica and Rutabaga sniffed the air. Rutabaga rises from his chair to see who could be standing outside his tent.

"What is it Vanguard?" Rutabaga asked as he open the entryway to his tent.

"Commander, you're not going to believe this, but a man fell out of the sky. He claims to have amnesia and to have come from a different realm. I questioned him thoroughly to verify he was telling the truth. I need to verify if he's no threat."

"So you brought him here so I can confirm whether he's a danger or not. We'll by the smell of things he doesn't appear to be armed. Send him in. I have a few questions I want to ask him myself."

Vanguard directs the young man he was talking about inside Rutabaga's tent before heading back to his own. The young man had black hair and blue eyes. He was pretty muscular and was dressed in simple garments apparently created via magic.

"Greetings sir. the giant said you wanted to verify my story?" the young man asked.

"That's right," Rutabaga replied.
1213132333132333332.title: Veronica's quest to find Gunter a wife

choices: Vanguard barely manages to subdue the Varigrand.
Vanguard is able to subdue the Varigrand with ease
The Tyrant subdues the Varigrand, somehow
12131323331323333323.content:
After taking the mysterious man to the commander, Vanguard headed back to his post. Since Rutabaga was with Princess Veronica and the mystery man all guards were required to stand guard by the campfire according to the default protocols.

"Vanguard, do you know what the commander will do about the man that fell from the sky?" Sally asked.

Vanguard shrugged his broad shoulders. "Knowing Rutabaga he'll most likely enlist him into the guard. Yet what gets me is that the man emerged from a crater ten minutes or so away from camp."

As Vanguard and Sally stood by the campfire at attention Tetra and Snatchem emerged from the woods. They then took a seat by the campfire.

"Did you guys find anything new where that man fell?" Vanguard asked.

"Nothing except a bunch of glowing leaves. I used a pair of magical gloves and an enchanted jar to gather them. I figure the mage and witch should be able to determine if those are the wishing leaves the dragons want the Tyrant to get," Snatchem said.

The night was remained peaceful despite the few surprises Vanguard and company have encountered. Vanguard still couldn't believe there was a city full of people of his new size and stature. Being as big as he is most people would think that Vanguard was a giant or an ogre, but many educated people know that giants are 20 feet in height or taller and ogres have green skin and are two feet taller than Valaburgians. Before Vanguard could wonder any further a piercing roar could be heard in the distance.

"What now?" Tetra asked.

"That my dear is a Varigrand. They are huge beasts that roam Bowlworld. It is said that Ogres and humans native to Valaburg use them as mounts. They resemble huge quadraped bears, but they have horns that are similar to a ram," Tooolfordis said as he and his wife emerged from their tent.

"How did it find our camp?" Vanguard asked.

"Oh, we summoned it. We thought we do you a favor by giving you a new mount. We also enlarged your sword and made some armor via magic," Toolfordis's wife replied.

"You what?" Rutabaga yelled.

"Are you guys crazy!" Veronica said.

With a snap of his fingers Toolfordis uses his magic to hand Vanguard his sword and put him in his new armor.

"You'll need these to stop the Varigrand. We'll help you, but you have to catch the beast and mount it."

Before Vanguard could ask the mage the Varigrand stomps into the camp and roars.
12131323331323333323.title: Vanguard goes back to his post.

121313233313233333233.content:
At this, the Tyrant stuck his head out of his tent. "Oh, a Varigrand. I didn't know we were that close to their migration route." He looked at Rutabaga, who looked over at Toooldforthis and Mavius. "I see. Something for our size-challenged friend to ride." He looked at Vanguard. "Well, what are you waiting for; go tame and ride it."

"Easy for you to say," said Vanguard. "You're not the one that's expected to tame it!"

The Tyrant raised an eyebrow. "Are you saying that I couldn't do it?"

"I didn't say that," said Vanguard.

"It still sounded like a challenge to me," said the Tyrant. "In that case, here's a wager; the one who does not tame, and ride, the Varigrand will be the other's servant for the rest of the trip."

"We already work for you," said Vanguard.

"As in you help me get dressed, get my bed ready, and that sort of stuff," the Tyrant. "Likewise, I'll do the same for you if you win."

Vanguard grinned. "You're on!"

Rutabaga chuckled. "Have fun." He walked over to the fire, and sat down, motioning to the rest to do the same. "Anything ready to eat?"

"Got some dried meat and vegetables," said Tetra.

"Good," said Rutabaga. "I hope you didn't doctor it up."

"There isn't a contract on you, that I know of."

"Good." Rutabaga accepted the food, and took a bite. "Now, to watch the fun."



Vanguard charged the Varigrand, only for the creature to toss him away.

The Tyrant chuckled. "Is that the best you have?"

Vanguard looked at him, and rushed the creature again, and this time, decided to try and jump on its back. However, he was tossed off.

"You'll have to do better than that," the Tyrant said, as he started picking some flowers.

Vanguard charged again. Again, he got tossed. He looked at the Tyrant. "What about you? All I'm going is wearing it down, only for you to just get on it, right!"

"A healthy Varigrand can fight an opponent for three days, without stopping for food or drink, or even to use the bathroom," said the Tyrant. "You must fight smarter, not harder."

"Let's see how you manage," Vanguard said, as he stood up.

"Very well." The Tyrant walked up to the Varigrand, and held out the flowers. The creature looked at him, looked at the flowers, looked at him again. looked at the flowers, ate the flowers, and let out a breath. The Tyrant patted the creature's nose, and scratched its forehead. He then climbed up its side, and got on its back.

"Walk."

The creature walked.

"Stop."

The creature stopped.

The Tyrant looked at Vanguard. "I believe we had a bet."

Vanguard chuckled nervously. "Tell me you weren't serious about it."

The Tyrant grinned, as he jumped from the creature. "Only if you don't make foolish choices," said the Tyrant. He then patted the creature, and it laid down.

"Um, how did you manage to get that creature to not harm you?" Vanguard asked.

"By convincing it that I wasn't trying to harm it," said the Tyrant. "A gift of flowers helps. You have to wait until it decides to let you on, and make sure to get off when it doesn't want you on anymore."

"You've done this before, right?" Vanguard asked.

The Tyrant chuckled. "This was my first time. But, I've done a lot of research on the creatures around here, in the off-chance we stumbled across one. Always treat creatures with kindness; they'll be less likely to kill you if something makes them upset."

"Well spoken," Rutabaga said, as he came over. "If nothing else, it's a healthy-looking creature, and I'm sure the Valaburg humans, and ogres, will respect the Tyrant for being able to tame, and ride, one of them; only the greatest of their warriors manage the feat." He grinned as he looked at the Tyrant. "Flowers tames the beast?"

"Fancy a ride?" the Tyrant asked.

Rutabaga looked at the creature. "Another time perhaps."

"What about me?" Vanguard asked.

Rutabaga grinned. "You'd better get some flowers."

Just then, something caused the Commander to become still. "Someone is watching us."
121313233313233333233.title: The Tyrant subdues the Varigrand, somehow

choices: The next morning Vanguard tames the wild Varigrand by offering it flowers
The next morning Vanguard tames the wild Varigrand by giving him fruit
1213132333132333332331.content:
"What do you think you're doing with my Varigrand?" A Valaburgian man asked.

Vanguard and the others saw that the man was Vanguard's height but at least 200 pounds heavier than Vanguard himself. He wore dragon scale armor and a sword made a Diamond Golem. The Tyrant dismounted from the Varigrand.

"This is your Varigrand?" the Tyrant asked.

"You bet. Now if you don't mind I'll be taking her back," the Valaburgian monster hunter said.

The man let out a low whistle. At this the Varigrand walked over to him.

"Who is this giant?" The mysterious amnesiac man that Vanguard brought to Rutabaga earlier asked.

"I am Tyson Rexius. I'm the world's best licensed monster hunter. And who may you be?"

"I am the Tyrant of Big Fat Pig City and this is my hired escort."

"So you're Tyson Rexius. I am Princess Veronica of Everwood. I thought you would be closer to the size of an average human though."

Tyson started to chuckle. "Five years ago that would have been the case. I since moved to Valaburg as you can tell by my size. I see the esteemed Rutabaga Blackfur is with you. I guess the girl and the men must be his guards."

"That's right. The girl is Sally Butcher, the big guy is Vanguard Green who recently grew to his current size thanks to some Wishing Fairy and the other young man you mentioned I have no idea who he is. He can't even remember his own name," Rutabaga said.

"Is that so? Amnesiacs are an oddity in Bowlworld. Also people wishing themselves to be Valaburgian sized is rare to. I'll you what. Let's say I know where to find a Varigrand from here for your friend."

"What's the catch ?" Vanguard asked.

"If you can mount a wild Varigrand who dwells just outside this forest I'll drop any theft charges that I would file against your party. Thievery is looked down upon in Valaburg. Anyone accused of thievery is subject to pay a fine or face imprisonment," Tyson said.

"He'll do it. I had no idea that your beautiful Varigrand was yours. I'm sure if he succeeds you can overlook his foolishness. Vanguard thought your Varigrand was a wild Varigrand," the Tyrant said.

Vanguard rolled his eyes at the Tyrant. He was beginning to understand why people hated him. He's nothing but a jerk.

"That's great to hear. We'll find the wild Varigrand in the morning," Tyson said.

"I guess that wager we made is void," Vanguard said.

"Not quite. The Varigrand might have been Tyson's, but you still have to tame a wild Varigrand before I do. In other words, the challenge is still on. Hope you don't mind being my servant?" The Tyrant said.

The Tyrant heads back inside of his tent to get some sleep.

"Vanguard, you want some advice about about Varigrands?" Tyson asked.

"Sure, anything to avoid being humiliated by the Tyrant."

Tyson whispers into Vanguard's ear so only Vanguard would know the advice that Tyson was telling him.

"Is that so? And you're saying you know this from experience? That should definitely help."

"No problem. I certain that everyone here has to put up with him since they are either being paid or made a nonaggression pact. Just remember what I told you and that wild Varigrand will be yours to ride."
1213132333132333332331.title: Licensed Monster Hunter

choices: After a few hours they make it to Valaburg
On the way to Valaburg they encounter a travelling female jester
The Real Reason the Tyrant Lost
12131323331323333323312.content:
The next morning, after eating a hearty breakfast Tyson lead Vanguard and the rest of his party to the edge of the forest. Just outside the forest a massive male Varigrand was foraging for food.

"That Varigrand is larger than Tyson's," the amnesiac said.

"This should be easy, " the Tyrant said as he approached the Varigrand with some flowers.

However, the Varigrand takes a sniff of the flowers and turns his nose.

"What Varigrand doesn't like flowers?" Rutabaga asked as he observed the Tyrant failing to catch the Vaeigrand's attention.

"Normally they do, but some Varigrands are picky eaters. Tyson told me this last night," Vanguard said as he picked some fruit off a few trees.

Vanguard approaches the Varigrand with a basket of fruit. He then whistles to get the Varigrand's attention. The Varigrand's ears perk up and he begins sniffing the air. The Varigrand runs past the Tyrant and the Amnesiac who decided to give Varigrand taming a try.

"Is this what you want? Vanguard asked the Varigrand.

The Varigrand digs into the fruit basket as soon as Vanguard set the basket on the ground. Vanguard started petting the Varigrand. After the Varigrand was finished eating he crouched down so Vanguard could mount him.

"Nice work Vanguard," Mauvius said. Now we can leave. The leaves that Snatchem brought last night are what the dragons were asking the Tyrant to get."

"Well, since I tamed this Varigrand that means the Tyrant will be my servant for the rest of the trip," Vanguard said.

"Not exactly. I hired Simon here to do it for me," the Tyrant said.

"Really? That's not fair," Vanguard said.

"I make the rules and I can do whatever I want. Simon please tend to Mr. Green's needs for the rest of the trip," the Tyrant said.

The amnesiac walked over to Vanguard. "Is your name really Simon?" Vanguard asked.

"I don't know. The Tyrant just paid me to tend to your needs. You can call me Simon if you want."

"Suck it up Vanguard. The Tyrant is allowed to change his terms if he wants. I also want you to partner up with Simon. He'll be joining the Guard until he remembers who he is," Rutabaga said.

"As you wish Commander. Simon, hop on. I'll be teaching you the ropes of being a guard. That means if I or Rutabaga gives you an order you obey."

"Yes Sir." Simon said as he hopped on the back of Vanguard's Varigrand.
12131323331323333323312.title: The Secret to Varigrand Taming

choices: After a few hours they make it to Valaburg
On the way to Valaburg they encounter a travelling female jester
121313233313233333233123.content:
Tyson looked at the Tyrant. The big man walked up to the leader of Big Fat Pig City. "You lost on purpose, didn't you?" he asked quietly.

"What gave you that idea?" The Tyrant asked.

Tyson held out some chewed up seed pods. "Zoonan seeds. Found them when I was rigging my Sasha's mouth-bit up. Varigrand love Zoonan fruit, even though humans find them to be a bit bitter."

The Tyrant smiled. "Like I told my escort, I didn't know how close we were to the migration route, but I knew the creatures would be in the area. I grow a few trees for my Valaburgian and Ogre friends, who have Varigrand mounts. I picked a few on the off chance we might encounter some."

"So, you hid one in that bunch of flowers last night, to throw everyone off?" Tyson asked.

"You carry a blade up your sleeve, in case you need it, right?" the Tyrant asked.

"Smart thing to do out here," Tyson asked.

"So do I," the Tyrant said. "Comes easy, being an Assassin and all."

"Why did you let him win?" Tyson asked.

"He needed the mount anyways," the Tyrant said. "Maybe he'll use his head from now on as well. That being said, if he gets an ego over this small victory, he'll find out just how I play for keeps."

Tyson chuckled at this. "I see. Let's get going."
121313233313233333233123.title: The Real Reason the Tyrant Lost

choices: Flying Monkeys swoop down and kidnap Simon
A woman in a flowing dress surrounded by guards walks by.
1213132333132333332331231.content:
After a few hours they make it to Valaburg. The city of Valaburg was a sight to behold. Rivaling Big Fat Pig City in size and grandeur, Valaburg was bustling with large people conducting business as usual.

"Whoa, this place is enormous. I didn't think there was a city larger than Big Fat Pig City," Sally said.

"I think the reason why people grow large here might have to do with whatever that is," Simon said as he pointed at a majestic shrine in the town square.

"You aren't wrong kid. They say that the god of war blessed a warrior and his soldiers with great strength. The warrior was fighting a dragon warlord who occupied the land. The blessing not only gave them strength, but huge amounts of flab to increase their durability," Tyson said.

"Let me guess the dragon warlord is the current Dragon King and after being forced to retreat he cursed the swamp," Vanguard said.

"That's right. How did you know?" Tyson asked.

"I spent part of my guard duty reading about Valaburg. After your arrival nothing else happened. Also, my boss and Toooldforthis suggested that I ought to read more often."

"The castle is this way. Lord Gunter should be expecting us," Veronica said.

Vanguard and the others were about to proceed until...
1213132333132333332331231.title: Valaburg, land of the big and mighty

choices: After arriving at the castle Vanguard begins training with Gunter's men
Upon meeting Gunter, Vanguard falls in love with Gunter's sister
12131323331323333323312312.content:
Vanguard and the others were about to proceed toward the castle until they saw a woman surrounded by guards walking by. It was obvious that the woman wasn't from Valaburg due to her slender, yet strong frame.

"Well if it isn't the Empress of Shinara. What would bring a power hungry harlot to this area," the Tyrant said.

The woman holds up her hand to signal to her guards to stop walking. "What a sight to see the fake ruler of Big Fat Pig City. Are you still letting the guilds run that dump of a city?"

"What's going on?" Simon asked.

"Nothing you want to get involved with," Vanguard said. "The last thing we want to do is to start a war."

"I see the good Commander continues to run away from his destiny. Such a shame. Unlike the last Empress, my mother, I sort of admire the wild type," the Empress scoffed.

"You're that assassin that broke into my home the other day to kill me. It's rare that an assassin escapes punishment," Rutabaga said.

"Oh, that? Just following mother's orders. She is the High Chancellor now. I just became the Empress two days ago."

"So what brings you here? The last time we met you tried to invade Big Fat Pig City under your mother's orders," the Tyrant said as he readied a knife.

"Now now Tyrone Anttrude, be nice," the Empress said. "We all know that starting a fight here would invoke a massive war."

"Tyrone Anttrude? The Tyrant's real name is Tyrone Anttrude? Huh? I guess it makes sense why people just call him the Tyrant. Knowing someone's true name can give you power over them," Mauvius said.

"Whatever Empearlia Presstia," the Tyrant said.

Before the two could continue arguing Rutabaga steps in to break them apart. "Enough! What are you trying to do? Are you trying to start a war? We have business with Lord Gunter. It is best that we leave."

"He's right you know. You don't want the prophecy to come true do you now? I could fill you in on the details, but I won't. See ya and don't trip over the Dilawog," the Empress said.

The Empress and her guards continue walking towards the market square. As they continue on Vanguard and everyone else except the Tyrant and Rutabaga look on in confusion.

"Was she flirting with Commander Rutabaga?" Sally asked.

"I don't know. I thought she was flirting with the Tyrant," Simon said.

"Enough gossip you two. The last thing we need is for my guards to start acting like fools. Only fools spread start gossiping. Now let's head to the castle."
12131323331323333323312312.title: The Empress of Shinara

choices: During the Meeting with Lord Gunter
121313233313233333233123123.content:
"So, what was that woman talking about?" Simon asked. "What did she mean by Rutabaga's destiny?"

"There's a rumor about how Commander Rutabaga, and his father, are of Royal Blood, and are the rightful King and Prince for the throne of Big Fat Pig City, but it's just a rumor," said Vanguard.

"Serious?" Simon asked.

"There is some supporting evidence," said Tetra. "The Assassin's Guild has paintings of those they've assassinated over the years, including Kings, Queens, Princes, Princesses, as well as Bastards and Illegitimate Issues - Rutabaga and his father Turnip share some of the features of the later ones."

"What does that mean?" Simon asked.

"He could be of a lesser son, or an illegitimate one," said Tetra. "Then again, he could be of an legitimate offspring of a servant who had illegitimate child with a younger Prince, meaning while he'd be related to royalty, he wouldn't be royalty."

"Sounds complicated," said Simon. "I mean, if he was of Royal Blood, what's stopping him from taking the throne?"

"The fact that there'd be a lot of people who'd want him dead before he even got crowned," said the Tyrant. "That, and he doesn't want the job anyways."

"I'd be forced to pick a wife," said Rutabaga. "Give me a Lady of Negotiable Affection, or a female Assassin who failed to kill me, any day or night."

"Would you have slept with her?" the Tyrant asked.

Rutabaga looked at the Empress. "She's an assassin, not an Assassin. I would have turned her over to the Guard, not taken her to my bed."

"So, she got away?" Vanguard asked.

"She saw what I did to a Legitimate Assassin, and ran out before either of us could grab a blade," said Rutabaga.

"I see," the Tyrant said. "She escaped because you were preoccupied."

"We still have business with Lord Gunter," said Rutabaga.

"Yes, we do."
121313233313233333233123123.title: Rutabaga's Ancestry

choices: While the others are relaxing Cinderella Bloback works Vanguard until he drops
Without warning a mysterious assassin tries to kill Rutabaga
1213132333132333332331231233.content:
The meeting with Lord Gunter had gone well. Gunter and the Tyrant agreed on a new trade agreement that would benefit both Big Fat Pig City and Valaburg. Lord Gunter had also offered to treat the Tyrant and his escort as guests. It will be two weeks before Vanguard and his party can safely collect the mud they need from the Swamp of Peril. As soon as the meeting had ended Gunter asked Captain Cinderella Bloback to train Vanguard after hearing about his predicament, Vanguard and the others were currently at the royal training grounds.

"That Vanguard is a quick learner. Most of the immigrants we vet struggle under the required training regimen. After a few days she may have him train with the troops. The training that the Valaburgian army undergoes is much harsher than this," Lord Gunter said.

"In the Guard I train my guards to be the best that they can be. Vanguard's been in the guard for thirteen years."

"Really?" Sally asked. "He would have been a boy no older than twelve or thirteen. Yet I decided to join the Guard once I turned fifteen."

"So Gunter, have you found a wife yet?" Veronica asked.

"Well, since the last time you were I started courting Cinderella Bloback. It's been two years as a matter of fact. I plan on proposing at tomorrow's royal ball," Gunter said.

"Congratulations. I'm sure she'll make a fine queen," the Tyrant said.

"She sure will. Hey Rutabaga, have you been thinking about getting married, yet?" Gunter asked.

"I don't plan on it soon. I rather enjoy the company of a Lady of Negotiable Affection or a female Assassin. Besides if I did marry anyone they would have to meet my tastes."

"Tastes? That's nice coming from a pervert who preys upon women," the Empress said.

"Why are you still here? Go back to Shinara already," The Tyrant growled.

"Darling, I'm here for the annual Valaburgian Ball. Also I made a peace offering with Valaburg. In order for our nations to maintain peace we agreed upon having Ambassadors to broker trade agreements. Sir Marcus O'Flare will make Shinara proud," the Empress said as she pointed at a large hulking man training alongside Vanguard.

"That's right. Within a year or two Sir Marcus will fit right in after the immigration process," A Valaburgian woman said as she observed the two men training under Captain Cinderella Bloback.

"It looks like my sister has taken a liking to Vanguard. She's a hard woman to impress. Yet if Vanguard weds her he won't have to go through the normal vetting process since he's already Valaburgian sized," Gunter said.

"That's not true brother. He may be cute, but I am not into him. If you don't mind I have to head back to the Monster Hunting Guild. Guildmnaster Tyson wants me to teach some of our new recruits."

Gunter's sister leaves the Training grounds. Rutabaga and the others look on as the Valaburgian princess leaves.

"It's going to be awhile before Megaira returns. She's a member of at least three different guilds. In the meantime, we relax. The royal spa should be good after all that travelling. Also the attendants do love to pleasure guests."

"Works for me. Hopefully they're as good as the Ladies of Negotiable Affection. They give the best messages while patching up torn clothes," Rutabaga said.

"You won't be let down Commander Rutabga. Please follow me."
1213132333132333332331231233.title: After the Meeting

choices: The Scent was well disguised by the silver and some aniseed oil.
12131323331323333323312312332.content:
Suddenly, Rutabaga fell to the ground, shoving Guntar in the process. The two looked at a crossbow bolt that was embedded in the wall.

"You saved my life," said Guntar, as he stood back up. "Or, at least, you would have if I was the same size as you. This, it would have laid me up for a few months."

Rutabaga stood up, and walked up to the bolt. "The fact that you were in the line of fire was secondary to the person who loosed this bolt. Look at it."

Guntar looked at the bolt. "Its coated in silver."

"To keep a werewolf from healing," said Rutabaga. "I was told this by the Monster Slayer Guild in Big Fat Pig City. It seems there were some talks that I might get placed on their lists as opposed to the Assassins'. After all, I'm not human, same with a third of the Guards I have on the force."

"Heard something about that," said Tetra, as she looked at the arrow. "Slayers don't want to get a black bolt in their head if they kill you instead of us."

"Can you blame them?" Rutabaga asked. "Still, this attempt wasn't Guild-sanctioned - they'd have to openly challenge me, and there can't be any bystanders within fifty paces of me, to prevent accidents."

"Yes, because of the incident in the Marketplace," the Tyrant said, as he took a look.

"Incident?" Guntar asked.

"Not-Targeted griffon got killed with a targeted griffon's body crashed into a stall, which sent a beam flying towards a child," the Tyrant said. "The not-targeted griffon saw what was about to happen, and shoved the child away, and took the blow to the head, killing them."

"Tragic, really," said Rutabaga. "The Slayer had to give the reward he would have gotten to the not-targeted griffon's family."

"I guess it would be," said Guntar. "No Slayer likes hearing that they killed the wrong monster."

"Still, that doesn't change this," said the Tyrant. He looked at Rutabaga. "Think you can track this person down? Obviously, they want you dead."

"Let's hope there isn't too much silver-coating on the bolt, or some aniseed oil to block their scent." Rutabaga sniffed the bolt, carefully.
