121313233313233333233123123323.content:
"I can't get a clear scent. Whoever they are must be real good. They coated the silver with aniseed oil. They could be anywhere and could strike without warning," Rutabaga said.

"That's not good. If they're bold to target you then that makes me a target too," Veronica said.

"Any Valaburgian werewolf is also at risk. In Valaburg we have a stricter vetting process for lycantrophes. Any Werewolf or lycantroph who wishes to become a citizen is required to swear before the Monster Hunter Guild that they will obey the laws of Valaburg without question," Gunter said.

"That must suck," the Tyrant said. "By the way has anyone seen the Empress and her guards? Her potential Ambassador is training with Vanguard, but she left just before the assassination attempt."

"Not to be rude, sir but the Empress was spotted looking at jewelry in the market square," one of Gunter's guards said.

"We'll see what we can find. My wife and I could work some magic on this bolt to see who it belongs to," Tooldforthis said.

"Great idea. Maxwell, take this magicians to the magic hall. With the help of the greatest Valaburgian magicians we can find this rouge slayer and put him or her to justice," Gunter said.

Maxwell escorts Toooldforthis and Mauvius to the magic hall.

"What shall we do?" Sally asked.

"We can't sit around and wait for the slayer to pick off Rutabaga or Veronica. However, the craftsmanship the bolt looks Berluvian. Knowing that should rule out our rouge from being elvin, dwarfish, or even impish. Berluvia has a population of humans and Ascended, which are humanlike except part diety," Snatchem said.

"Where the heck were you?" Rutabaga asked.

"Just making some money," Snatchem said.

"I hope you don't imply what I think you're saying. Thievery is against Valaburgian law," Gunter said.

"Who said anything about stealing. I just paid the merchant's guild a fine for a Valaburgian merchant's license. Everyone knows that for each new city you do business you need a license."

"That is true. An Assassin from Shinara would need to pay the fine to get a license to kill in Big Fat Pig City. Also, I'm pretty sure our rouge slayer was hired only to kill Rutabaga," The Tyrant said.

"Well knowing that our enemy is Berluvian won't help. If they kill me then my guards will be open season for the Assassins and the Monster Hunters back home," Rutabaga said.

As Rutabaga and the others were talking Simon approached them with the Empress and her guards in tow.

"If I may I think I may have a solution. While you were debating who tried to kill you I asked around the market place if there was a certain item that may help us," Simon said.

"Tell me your plan already Simon," Rutabaga said.

"Very well then, sir. My plan involves..."
121313233313233333233123123323.title: Rogue Slayer Still at Large

choices: The next day Cinderella Bloback has Vanguard train with the troops.
Follow Rutabaga as he grows to Valaburgian size.
1213132333132333332331231233231.content:
"Very well then, sir. My plan involves making you Valaburgian size. If we want to find this rouge slayer we'll need time to make a plan," Simon said.

"How will we do that? The slayer will know that Rutabaga is trying to avoid them if they see him grow to Valaburgian size," Vanguard said.

Rutabaga and the other see Vanguard dripping with sweat. He was also drinking a glass of lemonade to quench his thirst.

"I thought you were still training," Gunter said.

"I was. It's just that I completed all of the exercises that Captain Bloback gave me three times. She said that she wants me to train with the troops tomorrow. She said that the exercises weren't challenging enough for me."

"Well that explains why Marcus is still training, but back to more urgent matters. How will we buy time if this slayer is trying to kill dear Rutabaga?" The Empress asked. "If they find out our plan then Rutabaga is as good as dead."

"I just remembered a trick that spies use to evade capture. It's called a magical duplicate. To make a magical duplicate we need a lock of hair or a drop of blood. After the incantation is cast an exact replica of the person is created," Simon said.

"That's a pretty clever plan. The only issue is that Rutabaga runs the risk of getting addicted to the growth tonic. Once someone is Valaburgian size the tonic doesn't do anything, however it causes werewolves to grow faster and potentially larger. We literally have to restrict werewolves from downing entire bottles of growth tonic. Yet we may not have a choice," Gunter said.

"Well it's better than having no plan. Yet I wasn't planning on this," Rutabaga said.

Rutabaga pulls out a dagger and cuts off a lock of his hair. "This plan better work kid."

"It should. According to my memories I've employed this technique many times before."

Rutabaga hands Simon the lock of hair. Simon chants the incantation. Within a minute the lock of hair was consumed by light. Once the light faded the magical duplicate of Rutabaga was successfully made.

"Wow, he looks exactly like Rutabaga," Sally gasped.

"That's because I am Rutabaga, Butcher," the duplicate said.

"He even has my personality. This may work after all," the real Rutabaga said.

"Excellent work, boy! Now we can carry out the plan. Delilah, take the real Rutabaga Copperfindersson to the hidden chamber. Once there I need you to make sure that he drinks as much growth tonic as possible and eats as much as possible. Don't forget to pleasure him and work him to the bone as well," Gunter said.

"As you wish milord," a female Valaburgian werewolf said.

Delilah then leads the real Rutabaga to Gunter's hidden chamber.

"With that settled nobody is allowed to see the real Rutabaga Copperfindersson until his growth to Valaburgian size is finished."
1213132333132333332331231233231.title: To avoid trouble it's best to blend in

choices: Rutabaga decides to not drink the growth potion.
Rutabaga drinks the Potion, and Grows
Rutabaga drinks the Potion, but Shrinks instead! Someone Switched Potions!
12131323331323333323312312332312.content:
In the hidden chamber, Rutabaga looked at Delilah. The Valaburgian werewolf towered over him, easily fifteen feet tall, and she was in her human form.

"You must be a good sized wolf," he said.

Delilah blushed. "About the size of a Lesser Great Wolf."

One of Rutabaga's eyes widened. "Five feet tall at the shoulder, and ten feet from the base of the neck to the base of the tail?"

"A little bigger actually," said Delilah. "That's the size of the Eastern Lesser Great Wolf. Mine's the size of the Western Lesser Great Wolf. Six feet at the shoulder, and fifteen feet from base of neck to base of tail."

"I always thought how it was funny how the Eastern Lesser Great Wolf was was smaller than it's Western counterpart, yet the Eastern Greater Great Wolf is bigger than it's Western counterpart," said Rutabaga.

"Well, the Western Lesser Great Wolf and Western Greater Great Wolf are known to interbreed, so it's no real surprise to find that they are more close in size than the Eastern ones," said Delilah. "I mean, Western Greater Great Wolf is seven feet at the shoulder and twenty feet from base of neck to base of tail, while the Eastern one is ten feet at the shoulder and twenty-five feet from base of neck to base of tail."

"It's a good thing that none of the Great Wolf packs go around raiding farms," said Rutabaga. "I'd hate to have to kill any of them. I think I have some kin among them."

"Every werewolf has kin among them," said Delilah. "My brother joined the one pack that roams around here, and found himself a female he likes."

"Well, there's someone for everyone," said Rutabaga.

"Have you found someone?" Delilah asked.

"Not yet," said Rutabaga. "I mean, she'd have to share me with female Assassins that failed to kill me."

"How many times have they failed to kill you?" Delilah asked.

"Legitimate attempts, a hundred and twenty-six, over a twenty year period, and seventy-nine of those were female Assassins, who all found out how good I was in bed," said Rutabaga. "The only thing they complain about is how thoroughly I search them for weapons. Funny thing is, sometimes they come back later, for another go, which more-often than not, is less than a halfhearted attempt to kill me, and more of a desire to have sex with me."

"Seems to happen with every werewolf I know, including me," said Delilah. "Every male that I sleep with tends to come back for another go. Makes me glad that Simmins Zonk invented his Zonkiers to prevent unwanted pregnancies."

"The guy did have twenty kids," said Rutabaga. "He probably didn't want to have yet another one, from yet another woman, in addition to the other seven women trying to get money out of him, to say nothing about how his wife threatened to castrate him if he got another woman pregnant with one of his kids."

"Yeah," said Delilah. "So, which parent is the werewolf?"

"That would be my mother," said Rutabaga. "She and father have a very good sex life. Got seven siblings. Of course, some are cursed differently - my youngest brother Spinach is permanently stuck in his wolf form, although he works for a shepherd herding sheep, and has never lost a lamb. Then there's Lettuce, who is mostly stuck as a wolf, except during the week of the full moon, when she becomes a very hairy woman. Beet is a hairy man who becomes a wolf. Broccoli is a wolf who turns into a woman. Rhubarb is a hairy woman who becomes a less-hairy woman. Then there's Kale, who goes from a hairy man to a fur-less dog."

"Fur-less?" Delilah asked.

"He works as a servant/Seeing-Eye dog for a little old blind lady, who has a wool sweater for him to wear when she wants to go out," said Rutabaga. "Finally, you have Parsnip - and she's just a regular human. Then, there's me - I can go from human to wolf."

"Sounds like you and your siblings run the full spectrum," said Delilah.

"More or less," said Rutabaga.

"Anyways, here's the potion," Delilah said, as she pointed at a table, which was also laden with a lot of food. "Of course, you might want to take your clothes off; they won't be able to fit afterwards."

Rutabaga walked up to the table, and looked at the potion. "Tell me there's a Reverse Potion."

"There is," said Delilah. "Useful for in case a werewolf grows too much, or to punish certain criminals, who find themselves brought down to Normal levels."

"What if a Normal drank a Reverse Potion?" Rutabaga asked.

"Depending on how much, might lose a few inches of height, or they might shrink down to only a few inches tall," said Delilah.

"Useful to know," said Rutabaga, as he took his clothes off. "Of course, given how the food out there was just dinky stuff on toothpicks, might as well eat first."

"I know the feeling," said Delilah. "Why is it at diplomatic meetings food has to be things that are barely worth calling a bite?"

Rutabaga chuckled, and picked up a slice of ham, and ate it. "This is good."

"Cooks have their pride after all."

Rutabaga felt Delilah's eyes on him. "Like what you see?"

"Lord Guntar did say that I was to pleasure you," said Delilah. "Tell me; have you ever done it in your wolf form, with another werewolf who was also in their wolf form?"

Rutabaga grinned. "It has been a while since I've done that."

Delilah smiled. "I'll see to it that my size isn't much of an obstacle for you."

"That would be appreciated."

Delilah took her clothes off, and shifted into her wolf form, as did Rutabaga. Rutabaga was a good-sized wolf, as far as Common Average Wolves were concerned, and was actually larger than the usual Common Average Wolf, standing three and a half feet at the shoulder, and five feet from base of neck to base of tail, but he was but a puppy when compared to Delilah, who was six feet at the shoulder, and fifteen feet from base of neck to base of tail.

She laid on the floor, raised her rear slightly, shifted her tail, and looked at Rutabaga expectantly. Rutabaga grinned as only a wolf would, as he mounted her.



A while later, Rutabaga stood up, and walked to the table. "Tell me you're on the pill, or some such thing?"

"I am," said Delilah.

"That's good to know," said Rutabaga. "I mean, I didn't want to get you pregnant or anything like that. I mean, that's how mother got pregnant with me; she and father had a moment of pure lust, and well, nine months later 'It's a boy! Congratulations!' and all that stuff."

"So, what happened between your mother and father?" Delilah asked. "How did they get together?"

"Well, father was a Sergeant in the Guard, and was basically cleaning out the lockers of guards who were, shall we say, less than Honest - I mean, he didn't mind it if you had a few issues, but he really didn't like those who abused their power and harmed others for fun - shortly after he joined, he got into an argument with then-Sergeant Orlando 'Hatchet' Scalpel, who was threatening non-Guild affiliated store owners for 'Protection Fees', so that 'Nothing terrible would happen to their stores', if you get my drift - Sergeant Scalpel insulted my father over his upbringing, and my father gave him what he'd been asking for, a really hard headbutting, which is part of how dwarves settle their disputes with each other - the one still standing is considered the winner of the dispute. Father was still standing, meaning he was the winner."

"Was he brought up on charges?" Delilah asked.

"It seems that when asked about their respective bruises, Sergeant Scalpel claimed he tripped and fell down the stairs, while father claimed that he walked into a door-frame, which, given how tall he is, would have been plausible," said Rutabaga. "In any case, Sergeant Scalpel soon got transferred to another city."

"And your mother?"

"Well, she was new to the town, needed a job, and the then City Leader had been getting some pressure from some more influential non-humans that, unless non-humans were included into the Guard, they'd take certain matters into their own hands in regards to groups of humans going around terrorizing non-humans, and I'm not talking about Slayers doing a job, and given that one of these non-humans, a fire-breathing dragon, was holding the then-City leader's son, who had been caught vandalizing one of their stalls, the City Leader agreed, and passed an act that required the Guard to hire at least ten non-humans," said Rutabaga. "Like I said, mother needed a job, heard about the opening, and signed up. Commander Stoneface decided it was a Two-For-One deal, as he'd been getting pressure from the Seamstresses and other women to hire a female guard, so that they'd have someone to talk to about certain things they didn't like to talk to men about."

"So, politics is the reason?" Delilah asked.

"That, and they had a patrol together, which resulted in a Hostage situation, which resulted in them sharing a bed together," said Rutabaga. "That's the basic story at any rate."

"Sounds better than my parents," said Delilah. "Arranged Mating."

"Mother's told me about those, and wants no part with them, and told me not to get involved with those," said Rutabaga.

He then looked at the Potion. "So, I drink this, and I grow?"

"That's how it works," said Delilah.

"Well, in that case......"
12131323331323333323312312332312.title: To Grow or Not to Grow

121313233313233333233123123323121.content:
Rutabaga picked up the potion, and poured the contents onto the floor.

"Why did you do that?" Delilah asked. "I mean, there's a lot of people who would jump at the chance to become twice as large."

"Yes, but I'm not them," said Rutabaga. "Besides, The Empress knows about this plan, and would probably tell the assassin that I'm going to be the larger of the two Rutabagas."

"What about the other Rutabaga?" Delilah asked. "Do you want him to grow instead?"

"If he's like me, he'd pour the stuff out as well," said Rutabaga. "That being said, he can be the one out in Public, and I can sneak around in my wolf form, and track this person down."

"So, did you get a good sniff on that bolt?" Delilah asked.

"No, but I'd wager that only a few places sell aniseed oil in significant quantities around here," said Rutabaga. "That stuff is expensive after all."

"Yes, and is usually used for upper-crust perfumes and such," said Delilah. "Can't stand the scent of the stuff myself."

"Not many werewolves can," said Rutabaga. "I make it an unwritten rule that my Guards can't wear more than two squirts of the stuff in a day - male or female. Then again, most can't afford it anyway."

"So, just what makes you think that you can track this person down?" Delilah asked.

Rutabaga grinned. "I always get who I'm after. Not the first time I didn't start off with a good scent."

"What will you do if you catch this person?" Delilah asked.

"Turn him over to the local Slayers, Assassins, and Guards," said Rutabaga. "After all, there is a certain amount of etiquette to be followed if you're a Slayer or an Assassin, and the Guards will want to know who hired them to do the job. After that, they'll face the hangman, or whatever you Executioner prefers to call himself."

"Actually, being the Executioner is my job," said Delilah.

Rutabaga looked at her. "I hate to ask, but what do you normally use?"

"A silver-lined steel ax, among other axes," said Delilah. "The Fang-and-Claw approach is a bit uncivilized, not that I don't know how to tear someone's head off with my jaws."

"I've done it a few times, but it's always messy, having to clean the blood out of my uniform and such," said Rutabaga. "Had to burn my cape once, because I couldn't tell what was blood, and what was spilled paint, and the usual person who cleans my uniform had an issue where paint was concerned."

"The scent?"

"Nope. Broke out in hives."

"Ah." Delilah looked at the spilled potion. "I'll have someone clean that up."

"Yes, and take me to your room," said Rutabaga.

"You want to have another go already?" Delilah asked.

"No, but your room would be the last place an assassin, or a slayer, would look to find me," said Rutabaga.

"I see," said Delilah. "Useful."
121313233313233333233123123323121.title: Rutabaga decides to not drink the growth potion.

choices: Continue following Rutabaga as he grows
Let's see what Vanguard is up to
121313233313233333233123123323122.content:
"Well, in that case..." Rutabaga picks up the growth potion and downs it. "Might as well stick to the plan. Also I can always shrink back down to my normal size afterwards. Besides the Tyrant would kill the Empress if she dared tell the assassin about this plan."

Rutabaga starts to grow taller and his muscles double in size.

"Looks like the potion is starting to kick in. Let's begin," Delilah said as she motioned the growing Rutabaga towards the food on the table.

Rutabaga begins chowing down as the growth potion started to increase his appetite.

"So is it true, that your Tyrant would kill the Empress if she told anyone about the plan? I sensed complete hatred emanating off of them, but I had no idea it was that intense," Delilah said.

Rutabaga finishes off his third plate and downs another growth potion. After drinking another growth potion grows another few inches and his muscles grow larger again, but this time he gains twenty pounds of fat. "He would if he wasn't on diplomatic business."

"I thought that would be a possibility," Delilah said.

Rutabaga continues to gorge on the food on the table. Delilah watches in amazement as the smaller werewolf steadily grows before her.

If this was under normal circumstances it would take six months to a year for Rutabaga to grow to the size of a Valaburgian werewolf. At this rate it could take three to four days.
121313233313233333233123123323122.title: Rutabaga drinks the Potion, and Grows

choices: Toooldforthis and Mauvius have a breakthrough
An unknown woman materializes in the library and claims to be an oracle
1213132333132333332331231233231222.content:
Vanguard and the others were in the library trying to find information about Berluvian monster hunters. So far they haven't found anything that would help them out.

"So far there isn't anything on Berluvians except that they're a bunch of travelling nomads and they have settlements during the winter. However, I found this book that covers every Valaburgian potion. Who knew there were two different types of growth potions and a shrinking potion. The first growth potion is used for immigrants and the other potions are used by Valaburgian mages during times of war and to get Valaburgian werewolves to a manageable size if they get addicted to the growth tonic," Vanguard said.

"Who cares about some damn potions! We're supposed to be researching Berluvian monster hunters," Tetra said.

"Quiet you two. I just found a book on Berluvian wildlife hunting," the Rutabaga duplicate said "This book should offer some info, but not everything we need."

"Amazing work commander as always. Your original would be impressed by the uncanny instincts you have," the Tyrant said.

"Thanks. I just hope the original doesn't do anything foolish and dump the potion on the ground and try to hunt down the assassin."

"Why do you say that?" Simon asked.

"Because I would try to do the same thing. I'd hate to track down my own scent and see myself lying on the ground dead.If he drinks the potion the plan should work. The last thing we need is to tell the enemy that there are two of me running around."

"You make a valid point. Well, we won't know until a couple of days when Delilah and Rutabaga leave the hidden chamber together," Vanguard said. "Commander, I'm going to check on Toooldforthis and Mauvius and see if they found out anything."

"Go ahead, Vanguard and take Simon with you. He is supposed to be shadowing you due to the bet you made with the Tyrant earlier."

"I was going to have him gather intel in the city, but with him being an amnesiac who remembers a spy technique I've never heard of until today I do see your point. He may remember something if I take him with me."

Vanguard and Simon head off to see Toooldforthis and Mauvius. The Rutabaga duplicate and the other resume their research.
1213132333132333332331231233231222.title: Let's see what Vanguard is up to

choices: Follow Rutabaga as he becomes Gordon Howlmoon
Follow Veronica as she and the other Rutabaga track down the slayer
12131323331323333323312312332312223.content:
Vanguard and the others tried to find out more about the assassin who's after the original Rutabaga. Unfortunately, Toooldforthis and his wife were unable to find any results.

"We tried everything, Rutabaga but we can't track the rouge Berluvian slayer," Mauvius said.

The Rutabaga nods his head. "Whoever they are would be foolish to try again tonight. Lest they risk exposure."

"Do you have a plan, Rutabaga?" Toooldforthis asked.

"I do, but it's classified. I will tell that Simon came up with it though. If anything we're secretly conducting it as we speak.

His fat was starting to coat his muscular physique making him to start look like a Valaburgian werewolf.

Yesterday Rutabaga was surprised that the chamber had a wash basin, a bed, practice weapons to train or plan a strategy against any unknown invader.

Valaburgians must have thought of everything when building this hidden chamber. Finding the place wasn't easy either. It took two hours of navigating through a maze to get here. On the flip side I'll be unrecognizable once I finish growing to Valaburgian size. Simon may hold some untapped secrets that could definitely help the Guard. Right now I have to focus on the plan and grow.

After two hours, Rutabaga finished his last plate and rose from his seat. As Rutabaga got up he sensed his change of size. He noticed everything seemed not as big as it was before and that his natural senses have somewhat been amplified.

"Seems like you reached the size of a normal Valaburgian human male. As you may have noticed humans who live here are normally nine feet or slightly taller. However, you're one of the few wolves who has self-control. Normally I have too reward male werewolves with sex if they cooperate. It usually wakes while I'm supervising them. But with you it's different..."

"Heavens no! I'm just saying you take more pleasure in the sex we've been having and the thrill of your senses growing stronger. Now let's have a good sparing match. We must do something to add some fun while locked up in here for the next few days, Gordon."

Upon hearing his alias Rutabaga snickered as he walked over towards Deliah.

"Let's see what you got, big man. You're now big enough to at least spare against me. Size isn't everything, but I thought now would be a great time to see how well you can handle yourself in combat."

Only the real Rutabaga Blackfur Copperfinderson and Gordon Howlmoon are aware of their last minute switch before Delilah supposedly took Rutabaga to the hidden chamber.

Now's the day I introduce myself as Gordon Howlmoon. It was nice of the real Rutabaga to allow me to switch with him. Either way the plan still works and we are the only ones to know of said switch. "How do you like your clothes Sir Howlmoon?" Delilah asked.

Vanguard was currently helping himself to a hearty meal. After a long day of training and trying to find who tried to kill the real Rutabaga, Vanguard decided he ought to enjoy himself before mingling in to see if the Berluvian assassin had shown up to Lord Gunter's ball. As Vanguard ate a group of Valaburgian women gathered around him.

"Pardon me good sir, but are you the man known as Vanguard Fisher Green?" A Valaburgian duchess asked.

"I am milady. What can I help you with?" Vanguard asked.

The duchess and her lady friends giggle. "So you're the man from Big Fat Pig City who wished to grow to Valaburgian size. I've seen you train with the army. Someone as new as you to our land you have impressed us with your talented swordplay. Thank you..."

Did you know that in order to become an honorary dragon you'll have to be turned into a dragon?"

"If you don't I may forget and tell the first Fool I find. You know Fools love to gossip."

"Fine, but if you break your end of the bargain before then you will surely die."

Meanwhile, the Rutabaga duplicate and Veronica were searching for the slayer in case they had decided to make another attempt during the ball.

"You know this sort of reminds me of the festivals we have in Big Fat Pig City. Yet I never been to a Valaburgian ball before. After spending two days in Valaburg I see that they know how to get their soldiers into top shape," the Rutabaga duplicate said.

"While Valaburgians are always known to be immensely fat and strong they value a hard day's work. Also Valaburgians tend to grow in a manner that gives them a low center of gravity if I remember correctly," Veronica said.

"So when the real me emerges from the hidden chamber he'll have the body shape and size like any other Valaburgian?"

Veronica nods her head. "I have no doubt about..." Veronica sniffs the air. "Do you smell that Rutabaga?"

The Rutabaga duplicate begins sniffing the air as well. "I do and it isn't good."

Veronica and the other Rutabaga track the scent to just outside the courtyard. When they reach the courtyard they see...

1213132333132333332331231233231222333.content:
When they reach the courtyard they see a lone Berluvian woman brandishing a dagger. The Berluvian also had a crossbow and several daggers on her person.

"Greetings Rutabaga, you probably know why I'm here don't you?" the Berluvian woman said.

"You're here to kill me. Who would of thought that another werewolf would try to kill me. Why don't don't you cut the crap and tell me why you are hunting your own kind?"

"Simple. I was paid handsomely by the Assassin and Monster Hunter guilds to kill you. Oh and by the way I know that you swapped places with your double. If you were your double I would have smelled that magic coming off of you," The Berluvian werewolf bounty hunter said.

"So you're a bounty hunter. My father describes people like you as shameless sellswords. My father always said that werewolves who resort to such a practice are no better than humans," Veronica said.

"Your Lord Fauna Flora Crestshield's daughter. Who is the werewolf king to lecture me on how I should live? He may be one of the few wolves in the world that can transform into an anthropomorphic werewolf at will, but he means nothing to me. I live only for myself."

"Who are you to insult the king of werewolves? You should show some respect," Rutabaga said.

"I am Bellona Wolfblade. Four nights from now Rutabaga we'll have our little duel. Enjoy your ball while you can."

Bellona pulls out a smoke bomb and uses it to ensure her escape. When the smoke clears Only Rutabaga and Veronica remain. Vanguard and the other guards arrive outside after hearing the commotion.

"Commander is it true that you swapped places with your duplicate?" Vanguard asked.

Rutabaga sighed and shook his head. "I guess you all heard that. Apparently this Berluvian werewolf has a better sense of smell than I do. I have to say that she might be more experienced than myself at hunting. She nearly killed me the other day."

"What gets me is why would the Assassin and Monster Hunter Guilds hire a bounty hunter?" Sally asked.

"My guess is that the people saw this as a chance to take over the city while we were out of town. There have been rumblings that the people were getting tired of Tyrants running the city. For all I know they could have installed a king or queen that they elected. The thing is my siblings don't know that they're rumored to have royal blood supposedly. Besides my biological grandmother abandoned my father on the doorstep of a Dwarf couple or that's what Grandma Leaf told us."

"So what do we do?" Simon asked. "If the people had taken over your city in a single day how should we proceed? That werewolf bounty hunter already knows your magical duplicate is growing to Valaburgian size."

Rutabaga contemplates the situation.

"There is someone who might know a thing or two," said Rutabaga. "Tetra."

The Assassin came out from the shadows. "Yes, Commander?"

"Assassins and Monster Slayers don't hire mercenaries to do their work, right?" Rutabaga asked.

"If the Assassins Guild wanted you dead, I would have received word of it, and made the attempt myself," said Tetra. "That being said, there's already a Protection Contract on you and the others; anyone trying to kill you, is to die."

"That's nice to know," said Sally.

"It is," said Tetra. "And the penalties for failing a Protection Contract are more serious than failing an Assassination Contract - if the ones I'm trying to protect die of anything except accidents or natural causes, my life is forfeit. The other Assassins would kill me for my failure, unless I killed the one who killed you, but I'd be stripped of my rank within the Guild and kicked out of it, meaning that I wouldn't be a legal Assassin anymore."

"So, what do you think that was about?" Rutabaga asked.

"Sounds like some of the Nobles," the Thief said. "They don't like you, or the Tyrant, and could be using the fact that you are out of the city to stage their coupe."

At this, the Tyrant appeared. "They'd have to get in line, like everyone else trying to take over. The people may hate me, but even the lowest of them knows that I've made life better for them. We don't have to worry about having our children taken away from us after all, for one thing."

"So, what do you think?" Rutabaga asked.

"The Empress could be behind it," the Tyrant said. "She just delivered me a rather interesting ultimatum: Marry her or else."

"Do you want me to kill her?" Tetra asked.

A few hours later it was time for Rutabaga to face off against Bellona Wolfblade.

"Are you ready Rutabaga? That female Berluvian Werewolf almost killed you five days ago," Vanguard said.

"When have I last lost a duel? Besides, I've been training with Gordon. For a Valaburgian sized version of myself he's quick on his feet. I noticed that many Valaburgians are pretty fast. After this I'll enter the upcoming tournament. It will be interesting how I fare against someone who knows my every move," Rutabaga said.

Vanguard follows Rutabga to the courtyard. Once they arrive in the courtyard they see Bellona cleaning off one of her silver bolts for her crossbow.

"So the mutt has finally arrived. Let's make this quick so I can collect my bonus for the Assassins and Monster Hunter guilds."

"Sorry to break it to you, but the Assassins and Monster Hunter guilds don't hire sellswords to do a job that they're capable of. Especially a werewolf like you," Rutabaga said.

"Really? That's not what the new guildmasters told me. They promised me a legal license if I kill you and bring back your body to Big Fat Pig City."

Looks like the nobles have already replaced the guildmasters of the Assassins and Monster Hunter guilds. Damn it! I wonder which guildmaster or guildmistress they'll replace next. Rutabaga thought as he was about to draws his sword.

Rutabaga and Bellona get ready to strike at each other until they hear someone call out to them.

"Stop! I cannot allow this!" A woman yelled.

Rutabaga and Bellona turn their gaze to see an oracle dressed in a white robe. Her blond hair blew in the night breeze as she walked closer to the two werewolves.

"This isn't how it is supposed to go! There are larger threats ahead than mere bounties!" the oracle shouted.

"Get out of the way or I'll run you through with my sword!" Bellona said.

The oracle nods her head in defiance. "I cannot do that. You have to listen to me. A great evil has awoken!"

Rutabga shoves the oracle out of the way as he parries Bellona's sword.

"It isn't safe here. Come with me and I'll take you to safety," Vanguard said while the two werewolves clashed swords.

However, the oracle takes a step back before Vanguard could grab her arm.

"No. I will not go anywhere until I tell the Hero of Destiny my vision."

Vanguard sighed as the oracle refused to budge an inch from where she was standing.

If I don't do anything either the boss will criticize me or his larger double will. By the gods! Can someone convince this oracle that her life is in danger if she tries to stop Rutabaga and that slayer.

The oracle began walking towards the two dueling werewolves. Vanguard in turn leaps in front of the oracle to block her off.

"Get out of my way!"

"No, you'll stay put and wait. If you die your life will be on my head!"

Just then another shout was heard within the courtyard. Everybody halted what they were doing as the Empress made her way down.

"Stop the fighting! There's no need to fight now. There's a tournament coming up that Lord Gunter is hosting," the Empress said.

"Why should I stop what I'm doing for an arrogant Empress like you. In fact, I'm sure I was hired to hunt you down and bring you into Big Fat Pig City by Lady Ruby Cloverday," Bellona said.

"Ruby Cloverday? She's the guildmistress of the Seamtress guild. What does she want with the Empress?" Rutabga asked.

"Don't know don't care. When I strolled into town she was presented as the ruling leader of Big Fat Pig City. She offered a bounty on the Tyrant and the Empress of Shinara."

"What if I made you a counter offer. I can pay you more than any pompous Seamstress or guildmaster from that shell of a city. I can even hire you as my own personal Guard," the Empress said.

Bellona withdrew her sword. "How much are you talking about? It better be good or I'll slay this mutt right here and now."

"Who gives you the right to call me a mutt? You're a sellout for a full blooded werewolf," Rutabga growled.

"Silence! I will give you 20,000 gold for your first year of service. Any pay raises are negotiable based on your performance," the Empress said.

"Deal, As long as I get to show this mutt who's the better werewolf. If he thinks he can match my skills I'll prove him wrong in a contest of strengh by entering the tournament," Bellona said.

Bellona walked inside the castle with the Empress. Rutabga started clenching his fists as he was overcome with anger. The oracle was about to approach Rutabaga until Vanguard grabbed her arm.

"Let me go!"

"I can't do that. Don't you see that Commander Rutabaga is angry right now and that the moon is full. One thing I learned is to never approach him when he's this angry, especially on a full moon. He's more likely to bark and snarl at you if your an average citizen, but if your an assassin or a thief or try to attack him he will rip you to shreds. Five years ago I saw him tear three unlicensed thieves to ribbons," Vanguard said.

Rutabaga howled as he transformed into a werewolf. After he transformed he took off towards the plains.

"Oh dear. I can't tell the Hero of Destiny my vision if he's not going to listen at the moment. Please forgive me if I have been rude, but what I have to say is of utter importance," the oracle said.

The oracle followed Vanguard inside the castle.

1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
The wolf ran. He had to run. During moments like this, a werewolf had to run away, to avoid harming others. There was worse things than running.

Eventually, Rutabaga found a tree, and got under it. He laid down, and looked up at the sky. He saw the moon. He hated this time of the month - once the moon rose, every werewolf or wereman, and other werecreatures, had to shift into their other form, regardless of the rest of the month, when the Change was at Will. For the next three days, it would be like this, until the moon wasn't full. It was annoying. On the plus side, he wouldn't be the only one that changed. He chuckled at the thought of the Empress finding out that her new bodyguard was a real Bitch!

The Seamstress Guildmaster! Specifically, the ones who made clothes, and not the Ladies of Negotiable Affection. Why, he'd personally saved several of her members during a fire, and then there was all the other things. There were a few other things as well - the woman had to be a puppet ruler, for she was, admittedly, popular with a number of others. But, as for her ruling by herself, it didn't make sense. Someone had to be pulling the strings.

Soon enough, he heard a sound, and saw Tetra in the darkness. The Assassin walked up to him.

"There's something wrong about this," she said. "You don't just replace a Head Assassin with someone you pick."

Rutabaga looked at her, and cocked an eyebrow.

"He can't talk to you when he's in his wolf form, unless you too are a werewolf."

The pair looked, and saw the Tyrant, who walked up to them.

"He also doesn't understand how a Head Assassin gets the post." He carefully took out a knife, and stabbed it into the tree. He looked at Rutabaga. "See what I mean?"

Rutabaga nodded.

"Head Assassin has to groom his successor, to make sure he or she can do the job. Then, if the Assassin is ready, he or she has to kill his or her predecessor, otherwise, they will be killed themselves, and the Head Assassin has to find another," the Tyrant said. "Thing is, the others must support the successor, or else the successor will not be Head Assassin for long. This False Head Assassin won't last long."

Rutabaga grinned.

"As for the new Head Slayer, he or she will have to gain respect not only from the other Slayers, but from the Monsters in the city," the Tyrant said. "That, my friend, is not easy, and that's in the best of situations. As it is, I doubt the Seamstress Guildmistress is really in charge - I know her too well. Someone is controlling her."

"Who do you think it is?" Vanguard asked, as he appeared with the others, including Gordon, who was a large wolf, easily seven and a half feet at the shoulder, and twenty feet from base of the neck to the base of the tail.

"I have a few ideas," said the Tyrant. "Still, I wish they followed the rules - they were supposed to send me a nice letter saying that they were leading a rebellion against me for whatever grievances they have against me - I mean, how am I supposed to change things if I don't know why they hate me if they don't tell me."

"So, what should we do?" Sally asked. "I mean, I'm worried about my family, my father, my mother, and the rest of them."

The Tyrant chuckled. "It's simple......"
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.title: Follow Rutabaga as he goes for a run

choices: Two nights later a demon has come to kill the oracle
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
The Tyrant chuckled. "It's simple. We'll go and remove the conspirators."

Before anyone else could speak up the oracle stepped forward. "I don't think it will be that simple. The chances are that the conspirators are probably possessed by demons."

"Demons? What do you mean by demons?" The Empress asked.

"A few months ago I was attacked by a demon. Thankfully I was saved by a werewolf who had the ability to assume an anthropomorphic form," the oracle said.

"Like I said Lord Fauna Flora Crestshield is one of the few werewolves who could assume an anthropomorphic form. I just happen to be one of them."

Rutabaga and form turn to see Bellona Wolfblade in her anthropomorphic form. They begin growling and snarling at her. Rutabga barks and Gordon joins in.

"How dare you call me a bitch with no honor! If you mutts know what's good for you, you'll shut your traps," Bellona growled at the two werewolves.

"Interesting, it seems like werewolves that have an anthropomorphic form can understand werewolves that are in their feral form," Simon said.

"Indeed. Looks like a got myself a guard and a werewolf translator. See my dear Tyrant, how I plan to improve Shinara. With you at my side we can fix up Big Fat Pig City," the Empress said.

"Get lost!" the Tyrant yelled.

The Tyrant then storms off back towards the castle. Rutabaga and Gordon begin giggling.

"What are they laughing about?" Vanguard asked.

"They find it funny that the Tyrant may have a crush on the Empress and vice versa. It's kind of obvious judging by their eye contact," Bellona said.

"Me in love with him? Our marriage is purely political."

The Empress runs towards the castle in order to hide her embarrassment. Rutabaga and Gordon begin barking and howling.

"You want me to teach you two how to change into an anthropomorphic werewolf. I don't know. Mutts haven't been successful in this transformation. A majority of them just shift back into their human forms," Bellona said.

Rutabaga and Gordon respond by snarling and barking.

"Alright, I'll teach you if either of you can beat in the tournament. Do we have a deal?"

Rutabaga and Gordon howl in response.

Damn. This is the only drawback to having an anthropomorphic form. You can talk to people and to feral werewolves at the same time. All I have to do is beat both of them in the tournament.
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.title: We'll go and remove the conspirators.

choices: The Bout is an Easy Win for Rutabaga
Kerzon gave as good as he got, but Rutabaga manages to win
Well! Surprise, surprise! Kerzon manages to win, barely.
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
A couple of days later, the Tournament began. Plenty of fighters had shown up - guards from various cities trying to make some money, and get a better paying offer, mercenaries trying to make a name for themselves, slayers trying to prove their worth, knights trying to climb up the ranks, and even a few Assassins had entered - all to have some fun, meet up with old friends, settle scores, prove themselves, and of course, make some money.

Some of the early fights were random, for the Royal Tournament had yet to start. Two fighters would enter a circular area that measured ten paces in any direction from the middle, where they had to shake hands, or whatever, and the rules were explained: no lethal blows, no killing, no leaving the area, and the one who was knocked out, run out, shoved out, chickened out, or just gave up, was the loser, and the other person was the winner.

Rutabaga entered one such circle, and saw his opponent, who wore some rather highly decorated armor. It was painted black, with flames and lightning bolts painted on it. He had a plum of horsehair sticking out of his helmet. Spikes rose from his shoulders, elbows, and knees. His cape billowed behind him.

Rutabaga looked at his own; his armor was plain, and the only thing that made him stand out from any other guard was his red cape that had some gold thread stitched into it. He preferred it that way.

He then looked at his opponent's sword - it was one of those really wavy ones, which might prove useful in some areas, and could do some serious damage, if one wasn't wearing armor. He looked at his own - straight, edge on both sides, and was really good at cutting things. He would have to be careful not to harm his opponent too much.

"I am Sir Kerzon of Mogoz!" his opponent called out. "Vassal to Lord Kerchek! Protector of his lands! Slayer of his enemies! Savior of his daughter! Not to mention her husband-to-be. Those who face me, Die! Who are you?"

"Rutabaga Copperfindersson, Commander of the Big Fat Pig City Guard," said Rutabaga, calmly. "My job is to protect the city and the people. Many are the criminals I've captured. My guards do their job with few incidents. Those who try to harm them, face me. Assassins that try to kill me, end up sleeping with me. My enemies would rather flee than face me, but I always capture them."

Kerzon paused at this, and whispered, "Do you really sleep with the Assassins that try to kill you?"

Rutabaga pointed over at Tetra, and grinned. "That one tried to poison me. Thing is, I'm immune, or at least resistant, to a number of toxins that legal Assassins tend to use, along with some other types. I'll tell you the details after the fight, win or lose."

"Is she good?" Kerzon asked.

"Only if you don't eat her cooking," said Rutabaga.

"I'll keep that in mind."

The two shook hands, and stepped away from each other.

"Alright," said the Bout Judge. "Here are the rules, which I'm sure you've heard before. The outcome has no baring on your stance in the Royal Tournament!"
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.title: The day of the tournament

1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
Kerzon made the first move, and swung his sword. Rutabaga blocked the blow easily, and counter-attacked, only for his own strike to be blocked, fairly easily.

Rutabaga looked at his foe again, and saw his foe looking at him. Kerzon had a face-guard on his helmet, which prevented Rutabaga from seeing the fighter's face clearly, but those eyes were a giveaway. The werewolf grinned.

"You're a Slithrenz, are you not?"

Kerzon chuckled. "I told you I came from Mogoz. We are known for being reptilian."

"I have a few of your race in my Guard - very good fighters, and even I have a tough time keeping up with them in a practice bout," said Rutabaga. "The lack of a tail threw me off for a bit."

"Yes," said Kerzon. "My mother was full human, and my father was half human, meaning that I had too much human blood to have a tail. Still, at least I don't need to get special armor to cover myself."

"And the spikes, very practical, for dealing with Serpintines that try to wrap themselves around you - might hurt them more than they would you."

"Yes, and you are a werewolf," said Kerzon. "Saw you turn into a wolf the other day."

Rutabaga grinned. "In that case, let's stop holding back."

"Agreed."

The fight started in earnest.



Meanwhile, Vanguard was with the Tyrant, who was speaking to Lord Kerchek, who was a naga. Vanguard had seen nagas before - one worked during the day shift, watching the prisoners - but the way Lord Kerchek lounged on a covered bench made it look like he could strike at any moment, and Vanguard briefly wondered if he could stop the naga from being able to sink his fangs into the Tyrant. Then, he looked at the Tyrant, and saw the former Assassin playing with the handle of a slim dagger, the kind that was designed to pierce armor, and scales.

"Tell me," the Tyrant said. "You have spies within Big Fat Pig City, do you not?"

Lord Kerchek sipped on some wine. "I might have a few, just as you have a few in Mogoz."

"Of course," the Tyrant said. "Always useful to know if you're planning a visit, or if something important is going on that I might be able to help you out with."

Lord Kerchek grinned. "Same."

The Tyrant popped a grape into his mouth. "Tell me, what have they told you?"

Lord Kerchek speared a piece of raw meat with his nails. "Seems you have been overthrown, or so my sources claim." He tossed it into his mouth, and gulped it down.

The Tyrant sighed in annoyance. "They could have done it properly, while I was still there. I mean, here I am, out in the countryside, where I could raise an army to fight in my name to help me regain my city."

"Yes," said Lord Kerchek. "If I had planned to take your city over, I'd be sure to constrict you, and swallow you before your subjects, so that they'd know the price of resistance."

Vanguard gulped at this. "You don't normally practice that method of execution, right?"

Lord Kerchek looked at Vanguard. "It's usually reserved for enemy leaders. Others we chop the heads off, or hang. After all, eating someone is very personal. Besides, there's the human subjects to consider - don't want them to think that every criminal is going to be eaten."

The Tyrant looked at the match. "Your Kerzon is doing well against my Rutabaga. Future son-in-law, right?"

"Yes," said Lord Kerchek. "He'll make a good successor in time. Have you picked yours?"

"They'd have to kill me first," said the Tyrant. "That's not likely to happen any time soon. Well now!"


Back in the bout, Kerzon and Rutabaga had gotten too close to use their swords, and were grappling with each other - the helmets had been knocked off, and both were biting the other, or trying to, spending more time butting heads. Kerzon finally sunk his fangs into Rutabaga, but the werewolf had changed his own teeth, and had managed to bite Kerzon's neck. Now it was a matter of time. That was when Rutabaga started punching Kerzon with a free hand, just as Kerzon did the same to him. Then, they started rolling, twisting and turning, this way and that way. Finally, with a shove, they managed to push themselves away from each other. Both lay, panting, and exhausted from their wounds. They looked at each other.

"Had enough?" Rutabaga asked.

"I've had enough if you've had enough," said Kerzon. "You'll pass out before I do."

Rutabaga grinned. "Maybe, but I have enough strength to stand, and you don't." The werewolf stood, painfully. He hobbled, until he stood over Kerzon.

"What are you going to do?" Kerzon asked. "You have nothing left."

Rutabaga grinned. "True. But you'll have more issues with me on top you."

Kerzon's eyes widened, just as Rutabaga's legs gave out, causing the werewolf to collapse onto the reptilian, knocking the wind out of him. If he'd been fresh, he could have easily tossed the werewolf off, but exhausted like he was, he couldn't do a thing. The Bout Judge started counting.

"One!"

Kerzon tried to struggle.

"Two!"

Rutabaga grinned, his own weight and position being his only real advantages.

"Three!"

"I think I win."

"Four!"

Kerzon tried to shove, but his arms were too tired.

"FIVE! The winner, by Pinning, is Rutabaga Copperfindersson of Big Fat Pig City!"

The crowd cheered as some Valaburgians came in to pick up the two immobile combatants.

"Well, you fought well," Kerzon gasped out, as Rutabaga was lifted from him.

Rutabaga chuckled. "You as well."

The pair were then taken to the healers.



"Well, that was unexpected," said Lord Kerchek. "I've never seen him beaten."

"It was a close fight," said the Tyrant. "Could have just as easily been Rutabaga that was beaten, and I've never seen that before."

"There's more that my spies have told me," said Lord Kerchek. "Seems that demons might be behind your overthrow."

The Tyrant grinned. "They could have been polite, and done it while I was there."

Lord Kerchek agreed. "Yes, it was rude of them to take your city over while you were out here on a diplomatic mission, especially since you can now recruit an army to help you take your city back."

"Would you be interested in helping out?"

The naga nodded. "Of course."
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.title: Snake Talk

1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
A while later, the healers had taken care of Rutabaga and Kerzon.

"Good fight," said Rutabaga.

"The same," said Kerzon. "So, what about that female Assassin? Where might I find her?"

"Near the rest of us," said Rutabaga. "Just one thing - make sure to thoroughly disarm her, and be sure to search thoroughly."

Kerzon grinned. "Of course."

"And wear a Zonkier."

Kerzon laughed. "Always."

Rutabaga walked towards the Tyrant, who was still talking with Lord Kerchek, and noticed that Kerzon was walking with him. "Checking up on your Lord?"

"Just like you're checking up on your Tyrant."

Rutabaga grinned. "Alright."

They soon got to their respective leaders.

"Ah, Commander, Lord Kerchek has just informed me of the sad news that someone did take advantage of my absence to overthrow me," the Tyrant sighed. "Sadly, they forgot to make sure that I was dead. Also, seems that demons are indeed behind it."

"So, what are you going to do?" Rutabaga asked.

"Well, that much is obvious - still have to do this task for the dragons," the Tyrant said. "Then, I'll politely ask the demons to give me back control of my city."

"And how do you plan to do that?" Rutabaga asked.

The Tyrant looked at Rutabaga. "Do you think I haven't planned for the possibility that I might be overthrown? There's a Guild for it - Tyrant Ousters Guild - I meet with their leading members to discuss reasons as to why folks want to overthrow me - there might be a tax someone doesn't like, someone they like got arrested, or maybe my dog made a mess in their yard."

"I take it that last one is at me," said Rutabaga.

"You did order one of your trolls to grab something to bust Lord Scoona's front doors down," the Tyrant said. "Said something was a pine tree from Lord Sallin's yard, and said pine tree took out the fence dividing his yard from that of Lord Vunar's, not to mention Lady Trurnp's carriage."

"She should have stayed home with her husband," Rutabaga muttered. "And I had good reason to bust down Lord Scoona's doors - he ran over a poor woman as she was crossing the street, all because he thought that he could get away with murder. He laughed at me and my men when we asked him to come with us politely, and slammed the door in our faces."

"Before or after he insulted your mother?" the Tyrant asked.

"Doesn't matter really about that little detail," said Rutabaga. "At least my mother wasn't there."

"Yes, she would have killed him for calling her, what was it, a wet stinking bitch fit only for mutts and mongrels to have sex with?" The Tyrant asked, in a knowing manner. "Your father would have grabbed an ax to chop the doors down if he heard that being said about her, and then cut the guy's legs off, and he's in his, what, mid sixties?"

"Father believes in being fit," said Rutabaga. "He says he isn't just going to sit around in his old age, and plans to work on the family mine for as long as he can."

"He really cares for the Copperfindersson clan," the Tyrant said.

"They took him in, and raised him as their own; fed him, clothed him, taught him right from wrong, and shale from slate," said Rutabaga. "That love is a more valuable treasure than a dragon's horde. As far as he's concerned, he's a dwarf."

"Six-foot six-inches, as opposed to under five foot, but a dwarf nonetheless," said the Tyrant as he got something out of his clothes. "In any case, here's the real reason why." He handed the object to Rutabaga. It was a scroll.

Rutabaga unrolled it, and looked at it. He then looked at the Tyrant. "You actually gave your over-throwers advice on who to run what Guild? Is this some sort of trap? My one brother's name is listed as a possible replacement if I got killed! So is my one sister!"

"Is that a problem?" the Tyrant asked. "You told me that they could do the job as well as you. Same with the other names. They could lead their respective Guilds, and, very importantly, not try to take over."

Rutabaga looked again. "But the people who overthrew you would pick others, who wouldn't be able to lead the Guilds effectively, which could lead to a Counter-Revolt, and you'd use this as a means to slip back into power as a 'Leader-in-Exile Returning Home as a Hero' sort-of thing."

"Exactly," the Tyrant said.

"You are Evil," said Rutabaga. "No mistake about it."

The Tyrant grinned. "I thought that the black outfit made it obvious, to say nothing about the Obviously Evil Goatee, among other things."

"Be glad I'm not after the job of replacing you," said Rutabaga.

"Right, because then you'd have to deal with more people you don't like."

"So, we're just going to stay here?" Vanguard asked.

"For now," the Tyrant said.
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.title: The Tyrant's Plan

choices: The caitsith hypnotises Vanguard into forfeiting the match.
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
Vanguard triumphantly walked towards the arena as he heard his name. Upon entering he saw a cat standing at the opposite side of the arena. Vanguard scratched his head in confusion. He was expecting someone human or some other humanoid. As Vanguard looked at the cat in confusion the cat ran up to him and jumped on his head with her claws out.

"Youch! Get off of me!"

The cat clings to Vanguard's head tighter. In response Vanguard rips the cat off his head and throws her to the edge of the arena.

"How rude! Don't you see that I just wanna play? the cat asked as she transformed into her human form.

"You're a caitsith! I thought it was weird that a cat would enter an arena," Vanguard said.

"So the moron knows what I am. Good. It would be boring if you didn't put up a fight. Tee hee."

"It just happens that one of my coworkers was a caitsith. She was an excellent guard until it turned out that she was attempting to rob the whole town blind," Vanguard said.

"Cool story bro. Too bad I don't care," the caitsith said as she magically conjured up a whip and attempts to hit Vanguard with it.

Vanguard dodges the attack and prepares to counter the caitsith's attack. As Vanguard was fighting the caitsith the Empress and Gordon were watching the match with Gunter and his fiancé.

"Is it true that a caitsith used to work in the Guard?" The Empress asked.

Gordon nodded. "Three years ago a caitsith named Mimi was under my employ. My brother and I ran her out of town when she tried stealing the town's money," Gordon said.

"I've heard that caithsith's were tricky. They usually use magic and seduce their victims," Cinderella said. "Look like training with the army has paid off. Vanguard's a lot quicker on his feet and he's even gained a good five pounds."

"True, but it looks like he'll lose his cool. That caitsith is toying with him. She just turned back into a cat to dodge his attack," Gunter said.

"The match is too close to call. If you don't mind me I have a match to get ready for," the Empress said.
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.title: Vanguard vs. a cat? No, that's a caitsith!

choices: a group of Valaburgian women walking his way.
some guards from Big Fat City with Sargeant Wolgang. They are injured.
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
Vanguard and the caitsith exchanged blows. They were evenly matched. The caitsith with her magic and agility and Vanguard with his fighting prowess, strength, and girth.

"For a human I didn't expect you to last this long," the caitsith said.

"Like I said before. I knew a caitsith once," Vanguard said.

Vanguard and the caitsith keep going at it. In the end Vanguard grabbed the caitsith by the tail and threw her out of the arena. The judge then declares Vanguard the winner.

"That was close. Damn that caitsith was annoying. I'll go see the healer and wait for my match. As Vanguard walked out of the arena he sees...
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.title: A narrow victory

1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
The caitsith came walking up to him. "Not bad, big boy. That being said, you owe me."

"Owe you what?" Vanguard asked.

The caitsith grabbed him by the shirt, pulled him down to her level. "No one grabs me by the tail and gets away with it!" she hissed. She then kissed him on the mouth. "Be seeing you later, big boy." She then changed back into a cat, and walked away before Vanguard could do anything.

"Well, that's trouble for you," said Rutabaga, as Vanguard sat next to a healer.

"What do you mean?" Vanguard asked.

"You don't just grab a cat by the tail, and expect to not get scratched," said Rutabaga. "On the other hand, it looks like you impressed her."

"What are you talking about?" Vanguard asked.

"Remember that caitsith who used to work for us?" Rutabaga asked.

"I remember her," said Vanguard. "You and your brother chased her from town, right?"

"Not before my brother gave her a few good blows, and grabbed her tail to boot her in the rear over the gates," said Rutabaga. "Problem is, grabbing a caitsith by the tail is the same as saying 'Let's go out for a nice romantic dinner, and get to know each other better later. Actually, let's just skip the dinner.' That caitsith will be visiting you later, like it or not."

Vanguard's eyes widened. "Oh shit!"

Rutabaga grinned. "At least you aren't married, or engaged to be married, or anything like that." He then slipped Vanguard a packet. "You'll be needing one of those."

Vanguard looked at it; the packet was a Zonkier. "You're not serious?"

"It's that or you'll be having kittens with her," said Rutabaga.

"I wasn't expecting this!"

Rutabaga grinned. "Could be worse. My brother was married. His wife was not happy to see someone come into her room, expecting to see her husband."

"What happened?" Vanguard asked.

"Turns out that caitsiths aren't too picky when it come to the sex of their lovers, and when my brother's wife grabbed her by the tail, well, that just got her turned on all the more, especially when my brother found both of them together, and got dragged into it," said Rutabaga. "As for that caitsith, she joined the Thieves' Guild."

"So, she's going to find me, and have sex with me," said Vanguard.

"Have a meal ready, and she might not bother you, if she has enough food," said Rutabaga. "Sluth tends to be less interested in sex if my brother and his wife serve a big meal."

"Alright," said Vanguard.
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.title: The Caitsith Came Back

1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
As Gordon entered the ring the crowd cheered wildly as the big wolf entered the arena. On the opposite end was Titus.

"Looks like I get to cross blades after all," Titus said.

"Looks like it. Let's get this show on the road," Gordon said.

After the judge shouted the two men went at it with everything they got. They were evenly matched and countered each other's blows.

"Not bad, Gordon. Maybe after this tournament we can get you your own Varigrand. A few of the female werewolves in my guild said they would love for you to join," Titus said.

"So that caitsith. She's part of your guild right?

"You mean Mimi? She finished the immigration process a few years ago. She always likes using size changing magic to attract guys," Titus said as he parried Gordon's sword.

"I thought she smelled familiar. Caitsiths are known to be masters of disguise. My brother, Kale, grabbed a caitsith by the tail once. Thing is he was married so, yeah things got weird. He now works as a seeing eye dog."

"I can imagine, however Mimi might try to turn him a catbeast though," Titus replied.

"Interesting. Rutabaga has a few of those in the Guard. They can change between human and a bipedal feline form. Hopefully, Vanguard knows what he got himself into."
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.title: Gordon' vs Titus

1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
After several minutes Gordon managed to beat Titus by knocking his sword out of his hand and shoving him out of the ring. The crowd went wild as Gordon walked out of the ring. As he went over to the healer he was approached by several female werewolves.

"Oh my God! It's Gordon Howlmoon! He's handsomer in person," a female werewolf said.

Titus, Rutabaga, and Vanguard watch from a distance as the werewolves crowd around Gordon.

"That could have been me. I don't envy him. Almost everyday in Big Fat Pig City females fawn over me all the time," Rutabaga said.

Titus nodded his head in agreement. "True, he's a good looking wolf. Seeing a wolf his size is a good sign. This encourages more people to immigrate to Valaburg. The more people that immigrate the stronger the city becomes."

"I see. Well I have to get ready for my next match and then dinner. Just found out that the caitsith just wants dinner. Of course that could mean anything and since she was using magic to conceal her size I even slipped on a Zonkier," Vanguard said.

"That's Mimi for you. Just be careful that she doesn't try anything. She tends to get frisky around humans," Titus said.

"Thanks, I guess," Vanguard said.

Vanguard then walks off to get ready.

"Mind telling me what's that about?" Rutabaga asked.

"Mimi has a habit of turning humans into catbeasts. Most of the catbeasts in my guild were human. Yet at least they assume human form though."

"I see," Rutabaga said.

"Yet there was one exception. The last guy Mimi was with was a shapeshifter. Can't turn a human into a catbeast if they're a shapeshifter. Thing is the guy didn't even know until he transformed into a catbeast and immediately reverted to human form," Titus said.

"Interesting. If Vanguard's lucky he might have great grandfather's genes. There's a rumor that the Greens had an innate ability long ago. If Vanguard's a shapeshifter I can use him for more duties," Rutabaga said.

A devious grin forms on Rutabaga's face. Titus's eyes widened with shock. "You wouldn't. Very few humans can shapeshift."

"Don't be ridiculous. The last thing I would want is to set my guard up to get assassinated. I would use him to root out corruption within the guilds back home," Rutabaga replied.
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.title: Gordon wins the match.

choices: The Tyrant defeats his opponent, easily.
The man in shining armor is a better fighter than first thought
The Tyrant utterly humiliates the man in shining armor, before leaving the ring
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
"Come on," called out a man in white shining armor. "Will no one dare to face the mighty Lanceanot? Countless beasts I've slain! Defeated dozens of enemy armies all by myself!"

"Who is he?" the Tyrant asked.

"Him? Just a braggart," said Kerchek. "A farmer with a pitchfork would be more of a threat."

"Yes, plenty of farmers with pitchforks have made a difference in a fight," the Tyrant said. "Especially if they know how to use that pitchfork." He looked over at Rutabaga. "Do you have a space set of armor and a weapon?"

Rutabaga grinned as he looked out at the would-be fighter. "Breastplate, backplate, helmet, and a short sword, and you'll want some padding because the armor is slightly too big for your body."

"That will be fine," the Tyrant said. He then raised his voice slightly. "If you're looking for a challenger, I'll take you up on it."

The man in shining armor stopped yelling, and looked at the Tyrant. "You? You're nothing to me! I could crush you easily!"

The Tyrant looked around. "That might be the case, but no one else is accepting your challenge."

"Ha! Where's your armor? Where's your weapons?"

"Give me ten minutes, and I'll be ready."

"This will be easy!"

Rutrabaga chuckled, as he got the spare armor. "Yes, so easy, you'll be surprised at how easy the fight will be."



Soon enough, the Tyrant was dressed, wearing the breastplate and backplate, and helmet, with plenty of padding, holding onto the sword.

"Do you know how to use that?" Rutabaga asked.

The Tyrant grinned.

"I'll take that as a yes." Rutabaga looked out at the man in shining armor. "Take it easy on him."

"We shall see, Commander."
1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.title: The Tyrant is up.

1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
It was a no brainer how the match would turnout. First, the man charged straight towards the Tyrant. However, the Tyrant easily avoided the attack and knocked his sword out of the arena. The man then tried to tackle the Tyrant.

Meanwhile, at that moment in Big Fat Pig City, a Thief was freezing in the icy Porkhouse, which kept raw meat cold until it was sold. He looked at the Guard, who was a troll. Outside, trolls were slightly dumber than the average dumb person - they were smart enough to follow simple orders, like "Guard this Bridge" or "Catch that Person" or "Break down that Door" - but, stick them someplace cold, they became exceptionally smart, which made sense, as they came from the cold mountains.

"Any ideas?" the Thief asked.

"Many," the troll said. He looked at the others - an Assassin, a Monster Slayer, a Mage, and another Guard, plus other members of the various Guilds. "That being said, we stick to the Plan - we play along until the Tyrant and Commander Rutabaga come back to Big Fat Pig City. We do as the demons say, unless it's against the Law."

"That's good," the other Guard said. "We'll deal with them in Big Fat Pig City fashion."

The Thief grinned. "If they want to rule us, they'll have to accept our Rules - steal them blind, stab them in the back, kick them in the nuts, and sue them until they cry."

This caused the members of the other Guilds to chuckle, even the representative from Tyrant Ousters - Big Fat Pig City had a long history of conquering would-be conquerors - their weapons would be stolen and sold, same with their horses, and ships, and their pigs, among other things, and the invaders would end up becoming another of one of the average persons on the streets, in speech and clothes, if not necessarily looks, complaining about the City, yet knocking out any Foreigner who dared to speak ill of the place.

"Alright," the troll said. "Let's get out of here - you guys look cold."

"Thanks for the advice," the other Guard said.

"I just wish I could remember what I say in here when I'm out there, and I'm just a lowly Constable, Officer."

The other Guard chuckled. "Don't worry - I'll remember for you."

"Thanks," the troll said, as they stepped outside, and the cold left the troll's body. The troll blinked. "What we talk about?"

The other guard grinned. "Just how to deal with the demons."

"And how will we deal with them?" the troll asked.

"Same as everyone else," the other guard said. "Now, let's go tell the others."

"Right."


Back in Valaburg, the ogre and the harpy fought. It had been a close fight so far.

"Very well," the demon said. "I have some free time on my hands, but I must warn you; this isn't my True Form."

Rutabaga grinned. "I know. One of my guards is a demon."

"What is his Name?" the demon asked.

"I don't know his True Name, but he goes by Lucifier Satanus Belzandbub," said Rutabaga.

The demon's eyes widened at this. "That's a name my one cousin likes to use. Haven't spoken to him for a few decades."

"Well, this Lucifier has been a member of the Guard for the last twenty-seven years, and has been married for twenty-three to a Heavuns Angelicas Featherus," said Rutabaga.

The demon blinked at this. "You're joking me, right? That sounds like a Valkyrie name to me - they're our Mortal enemies!"

Rutabaga shrugged his shoulders. "To me, a Guard is a Guard - all else is moot. Racial, Political and Religious History is discussed in the locker room, but it is left once the uniform is on - dwarves patrol with trolls, werewolves with vampires, and atheists with devouts, to say nothing about nobles patrolling with peasants. To be fair, the pair did used to argue over certain things, until a certain incident involving a new cult at the time that decided the best way to communicate with their god was to sacrifice babies to it - seems Lucifier and Heavuns both took massive offence at this practice, and, while in the process of trying to arrest the culprits responsible for actually practicing this, utterly destroyed the cult. After that shared experience, they didn't argue as often, or so my father has told me, because other than which priest they want to bless their child, or which temple to worship at, they don't complain too much, although I think the religion in the household is sort of a mixture of both of theirs, but, like I said, to me a Guard is a Guard, although if we've never had that race join the force, they are advised to tell us non-lethal ways in which to bring them down, just in case they go overboard in a situation."

"So, you think that you can take me on?" the demon asked.

Rutabaga grinned. "Of course."

"Very well," the demon said. He looked at the ring. "So, just what are the rules to these fights?"

"Can't kill each other, and the injuries better be heal-able for the healers," said Rutabaga.

"Anything else goes though?"

"Weapons, potions, spells, shapeshifting, tricks, unarmed, and of course, simply tossing the other out, or making them quit or give up, or knocking them out, are all allowed," said Rutabaga. "Of course, folks like to be entertained, so be sure to put on a show."

"Sure thing." The demon entered the Ring, as did Rutabaga. The Demon looked at the crowd. "So, you like to be entertained! Very well!" Suddenly, smoke began to billow, and darken, and expand, covering the whole ring, as the demon started to laugh.

Rutabaga couldn't see a thing, and all he smelled was sulfur and brimstone. All he heard was the demon's laugh, which became deeper.

Then, the smoke dissipated, and Rutabaga looked at the Demon. The demon was the same shape and proportions as before, but now, he was twenty feet tall.

"THINK YOU CAN STILL BEAT ME NOW?" the demon asked.

Rutabaga looked at him, and grinned. "Yep!"

"We sent one of our guards to fetch the wizards who are traveling with us," the Tyrant said.

The shaman shook her head. "Arcane magic healing spells will take too long to rid your comrad of this cursed illness. A cursed wound can only be healed effectively by dipping the accursed into a lake blessed by a diety," the shaman replied.

"I can agree with that. That's why we have freewill. Unlike mortals the gods know the potential and desires of mortals," Gordon said.

After five minutes, the curse lifts in the form of smoke before vanishing. Rutabaga then leapt out of the lake. By then the ritual had already been completed. Wolfgang and the others smile as they see their comrade free of his cursed illness.

1213132333132333332331231233231222333312.content:
Meanwhile, in Big Fat Pig City, Turnip was in his cell, reading some Dwarven poetry. It was about rocks and minerals. One had to be a dwarf to understand what it meant, or have been raised by them. He looked over at Vivian, who was looking out the bars in the window. "You thinking about them?"

"What mother wouldn't be thinking about her children?" Vivian asked. "I just hope they're not getting into any trouble."

"Trouble runs away from them," said Turnip, as he set his book down, with a heavy thud. "It used to try to run away from us."

"Do you think you can take these demons on?" Vivian asked, as she walked over to her husband. She looked him over - the human was over sixty years old, with a long white beard, the type that was the style in middle-aged dwarves, to say nothing about his hair. She then looked at a reflection of herself - she didn't look a day over forty. "I mean, realistically speaking, you should leave the fighting up to me."

"And what would my mother say if I let my wife do all the fighting?" Turnip asked. "She'd cut her beard in shame."

Vivian chuckled. "Alright. When the time comes, I'll let you take two, and I'll take the rest."

"Nice to know we have the division of labor settled." Turnip was about to pick his poetry book back up when the door opened, and a high-ranking demon stepped in. "Oh look dear. We have a guest, and we don't have anything for them."

The demon looked at Turnip. "Explain."

"Explain what?" Turnip asked.

"Why are the people out there are acting like we aren't in charge, and going about like they do when the Tyrant is here?" the demon asked. "I am the Queen's adviser, and I need to know this to plot our next course of action."

"That's because this city has a long history of being conquered, and thus the people here have adapted the perfect strategy to deal with it," said Turnip as he picked his book up, and turned to the stone page he'd been reading.

"And what is this strategy?" the adviser asked.

"To go about it as if it's business as usual," said Vivian. "Until the invader leaves, or becomes part of the city themselves, like everyone else. Then, it's business as usual. Who knows, you might get an important part in a guild, or a temple, or a business if you're good enough."

At this, the demon growled, and walked out of the room, and closed the door.

"Well, that was fun," Turnip said, as he laid down on the bed he'd been sitting on. "Wouldn't mind having some more."

Vivian chuckled as she looked her husband over. "You sure about that?"

"I'm not dead yet."

Vivian grinned as she got onto the bed, and kissed her husband. "Let's make sure that I don't give you a heart-attack then."

Outside the door, the demon guard heard a Grinky! Grinky! Grinky! type sound. However, he knew enough not to look - they might try to use it as a trap, or something to attack a curious guard. More than one guard had been killed in such traps in other times and places. Also, even if it wasn't a trap, it would be very rude to watch.
