145123.content:
Skelly soon ducked under the eave of a store's front window, to keep the rain from hitting his helmet. While the wind and cold didn't bother him, the sound of it hitting his helmet was annoying. He glanced inside of the store for a moment, before looking back out at the street. However, something caused him to turn his head almost 180 degrees, so that he could look inside the store once more. If he had eyes and eyelids, he would have blinked, but he didn't so he just stared. That being said, whatever magic that kept him alive did give him the sense of sight, and he carefully looked at what he saw. If he had one of Adam's Apples, he would have bit it, and swallowed it. Instead, he kept staring.

What he was seeing was another skeleton, hanging in the window, as a display. A sign was on a stand next to it saying "I wish I'd shopped at Anthony's Apothecary sooner." Around it was a number of potions, which claimed to cure most anything. However, it wasn't the sign that caught Skelly's attention, or the potions, but the other skeleton itself. Skelly could sense the magic that inhabited it. It was looking at him, through eyeless eye sockets, and Skelly could sense it looking at him. Another glance told him something else - this skeleton was a female - the pelvis told him that. At least, Skelly hoped that the pelvis was hers, and that she wasn't really a male skull on a female body, or worse.

He then turned his head back around, walked over to the door, opened it, and entered the store. For a moment, he wondered if he should be respectful, by taking his helmet off, but decided, since the other skeleton wasn't exactly wearing much, well, anything, he could afford to keep the helmet on. Besides, one never knew when an alarm would be sounded, requiring him to put the helmet back on anyways.

"Um, hi," he said.

The other skeleton looked at him. "Hello." The voice was a woman.

Skelly chuckled nervously. "Well, that's a relief."

"That I'm a woman and not a man?" the other skeleton asked.

"To be honest, yes," said Skelly. "I mean, your pelvis is that of a female, but you know how some people are when putting skeletons together, using parts from different bodies."

"These are all mine," the other skeleton said. "I'm Susan."

"I'm called Skelly."

"Skelly?"

"Been around a while, and over time, with no one talking to me, I forgot my real name," said Skelly. "The Commander of the Guard was nice enough to give me a job when I first came here, and a name."

"I've heard about him," said Susan. "He's nice enough, from what I've seen."

"He gives me a reason to exist, and most don't run away from me anymore, except for unlicensed criminals," said Skelly. "What about you?"

"The owner of the place bought what he thought was a normal skeleton to use to decorate the place," said Susan. "You know how these places need such things."

Skelly nodded.

"Instead, he got me," said Susan. "He was somewhat surprised when I grabbed his wrist when he tried to mess with my breastbone."

Skelly stared.

"Not like that," said Susan. "I had, more or less, fallen to pieces, and he was trying to reassemble me, and putting bones in the wrong place - you know how it is."

Skelly nodded. He hated it when people, who were trying to be helpful when he'd fallen and popped a bone or two out of place, and placed them in the wrong location. "So, what do you do?"

"Mostly, I just display whatever it is he's selling," said Susan. "That being said, I keep watch when he's out of the store. Can't complain too much. Aside from the Licensed Theft, can't really report many crimes here, except to occasional person who tries to sneak a bottle of something out, only for them to get accidentally caught in my arm, after which, Richard comes to untangle them from me, and in the process, discovers the bottle."

Skelly chuckled. He'd done that trick a few times before. "So, what happened to you? I got into a fight with a Necromancer, who cursed me when I killed him. How did you end up like this?"

Susan looked at him and said....
145123.title: Skeleton in the Window

1451234.content:
"Truth be told, I suffered from a rare skin fungus," said Susan. She looked away. "It ruined my skin, and was affecting my organs. I would have died." She sighed. "There was a wizard who tried to help. The cure didn't work the way it should have. Instead of curing me of the fungus, the wizard accidentally burned off my flesh and soft organs. The only thing keeping me remotely alive is this magic that entered my bones. My family didn't want me, and neither did anyone want me in town. I ended up smuggling myself in here on a cart full of skeletons destined for places like this."

Skelly took Susan's hand. "I've been there. The Commander was the first person to look at me without fear. He accepted me for who I am."

"What about the other guards?" Susan asked.

"'A Guard is a Guard' is what the Commander says," said Skelly. "Once you put on the uniform, there is no humans, or dwarves, or trolls, or drakes, or vampires, or werewolves, or gnomes, or zombies, or skeletons, just guards. Likewise, no royalty, or nobility, or priesthood, or peasants, or any other such thing. One just keeps the peace."

"Has any of them ever caused you trouble?" Susan asked, as she stepped down onto the floor.

Skelly chuckled. "A few. But, luckily, the Commander has seen to it that one of my duties is knocking some sense into the new recruits. They think they've figured out how to hold a sword and shield, and have struck a block of wood a few times, and stabbed some hay, only for me to jump out of the stack at them, charge them, and see just how well they can handle an unexpected surprise. Then there's seeing just how good they really are, and then improving them. They learn to take me seriously, or they soon quit."

"I suppose that's good," said Susan.

"What about you?" Skelly asked.

"Well, Anthony paid good money for what he thought was just a display piece, so he couldn't just toss me without wasting said purchase," said Susan. "That being said, I figure I've saved him about half that in prevented thefts."

"And this Richard you mentioned?" Skelly asked.

"He's the clerk," said Susan. "He's out back, having lunch. He's okay, for the most part."

"For the most part?" Skelly asked.

"He has a cousin that's part of the Sinocas," said Susan. "I'm sure you've heard about them."

"Been trying to take down that group for a while," said Skelly. "Does the cousin come here often?"

"Every now and then," said Susan. "Funny thing is, Richard should be here, given that someone else is in here, namely you."

Skelly chuckled. "Well, let's go and see what's up with this Richard."

The two skeletons walked out back and found Richard....
1451234.title: A Wizard's Failed Cure

14512341.content:
There was a human sitting at a table. What he was eating was some sort of meat, some sort of dairy product, and some sort of vegetable, which were all between two slices of bread - in short, a sandwich. He looked up, went back to his sandwich, and then looked up again, as he looked at Skelly.

"Um, friend of yours, Susan?" he asked.

"Richard, this is Skelly," said Susan. "He just dropped in out of the weather, and saw me standing by the window. We got to talking, and I was wondering what was taking you so long to come to see the perspective customer, so he offered to come with me, to see if you had fallen or something."

"No, nothing's wrong, other than the usual stuff," said Richard.

"So, do you work just here, or do you do jobs on the side for your cousin?" Skelly asked, as he walked up to him.

"Nothing illegal about having a part-time job on top of a full-time one," said Richard.

"True," said Skelly. "But it is illegal to sell stolen goods without a Thieves' Guild License, in addition to the Merchant's Guild License that one needs to sell things anyways."

"I don't do any of that stuff," said Richard. "Thieves' Guild comes down hard on that sort of stuff. Of course, the Merchant's Guild is even more strict about that sort of stuff. Thieves' Guild just breaks a couple of fingers - Merchant's Guild chops them right off."

Skelly would have grinned, if he could have. Instead, he just have Richard a Look, a Look that said "But I can make things even worse." Then, he said, "Enjoy your sandwich."

He walked back out onto the floor room.

"You know, I've never seen another animated skeleton before," said Susan. "Perhaps we could do something."

"How about Dinner?" Skelly asked.

"How would we go about doing that?" Susan asked. "I know I don't eat, and I doubt you do either."

"No, but that doesn't mean that I can't pay for someone else's meal," said Skelly. "You could do the same."

The two then saw a woman try to put some small bottles into a bag. She stopped, and looked at them, in fear.

"Well, there is an unlicensed thief trying to sneak out of here carrying some of the more expensive perfumes," said Susan. "I'm sure she'd be willing to help me out."

"I know of plenty of Guards that could be willing to help me out with my part," said Skelly. "After all, something would have to be wrong with someone to turn down a free meal."

The pair walked up to the would-be thief, and grabbed her by the arms.

"What do you say?" Skelly asked. "Help me and Susan out with our night on the town, and the Thieves' Guild doesn't hear about this little smelly situation?"

The woman gulped, and nodded.

"Good," said Skelly. He looked at Susan. "Got any ideas that you'd like to try?"
14512341.title: Eating his lunch

145123412.content:
"Well, I've heard about a place called Itallyouup," said Susan.

"Hmm, I've been informed that they serve good pasta dishes there," said Skelly. "This place closes at five?"

"Well, that's when I get 'taken down' at," said Susan. "The place is still open for those who need it of course."

"I'll meet you at half past that," said Skelly. "I'll bring our respective stomachs as well." He looked at the female unlicensed thief. "Think of it as Community Service."

"Sounds nice to me," the woman said.

"Better than getting your fingers broke by the Thieves' Guild at any rate, right?"

"Right."

"Good." Skelly looked at Susan. "See you later."

Susan nodded. "Likewise."

Skelly then started to drag the thief with him.


Soon enough, Skelly brought his prize to the guardhouse.

"Nice catch," said the dwarf at the front desk. "Been looking for this one for a few days. Did she find you in a closet?"

"She tried robbing Anthony's Apothecary of some perfume," said Skelly. "Problem was, I was already in there having a chat with a nice lady when we saw her putting a few bottles into her basket."

"I suppose most would stop what they were doing if they saw you," the dwarf said.

"They'd stop for the lady I was talking with as well," said Skelly. "By the way, Ruban gets off around seven, right?"

"That rookie, yeah," the dwarf said.

"Tell him that I need his stomach, and I need hers." He looked at the woman.

The dwarf blinked. "Trying out a buffet or something?"

"No, but the lady I plan on going out with needs a stomach, much like I do," said Skelly.

"Alright, but she'll be your responsibility if she escapes," said the dwarf.

"I can handle that," said Skelly. "Keep her someplace safe. I plan to be back there at about half past five."

"Enjoy yourself," the dwarf said, signaling a few of the other guards. "Maybe she'll bring a frown to your face."

"Ha ha, very funny," said Skelly.
145123412.title: Planning a Date for Two Skeletons

choices: They decide to go through the motions
They hire a couple of bodies
They decide to do some people watching
1451234123.content:
Skelly was still laughing some time after he and Susan left the restaurant. "Did you see her face when she ate that spicy meatball?"

"I know," said Susan. "I mean, she said that she could handle spicy foods."

"At least Ruban didn't eat the same thing," said Skully. "After all, I would have hated to have to carry him back to the station along with that unlicensed thief."

"Do you think he'll be alright with her?" Susan asked.

"Should be," said Skully. "Wouldn't be the first time a guard had to help someone who had too much to drink to a holding cell. That, and there is a wagon nearby that he can drop her off with to take her to the station."

"I guess that's useful to know," said Susan. "I mean, she did drink quite a bit to quench the heat."

"I agree," said Skelly.

The pair soon stopped in the middle of a bridge, and looked out over the river, without looking too closely at the water for a number of reasons. Instead, they looked more at the moon.

"This is a nice view," said Susan. "The sort that couples kiss one another to."

Skelly chuckled. "That it is."

"Be a little hard for us to do that," said Susan. "No lips after all."

"Nor tongue or larynx, or other things used to vocalize, but those don't stop us from talking," said Skelly. "Still, I suppose that we could find a way to have some fun."

"What do you have in mind?" Susan asked.

"We could go through the motions, as if we were kissing, or take it even further than that and go through the motions of having sex," said Skelly. "Or, we could find an Adventurer that's short on money but still wants to get laid, and pay for him to have a good time with a seamstress while we watch. I've done that plenty of times."

"I suppose either of those could work," said Susan. "Or, we could keep on walking around the city. I'm not needed until the store is about to open, and I'm sure that the same is true for you. Then again, we could always go and find a quiet spot to watch other people walk by."

Skelly chuckled. "Sounds like my job."
1451234123.title: Later, after dinner

choices: Someone bumps into them, causing them to fall to pieces
Suddenly a scream is heard, and another, and the Ringing of a Bell - Trouble!
Suddenly, a building bursts into flames.
Someone shoots a crossbow at them.
14512341233.content:
"I guess we could keep on walking," said Skelly. "I mean, it has been a while since I've walked just to walk."

"I don't blame you there," said Susan. "Most people, they take one look at us, and walk away. Kind of hard to be social in that situation."

"Yeah," Skelly said, as they started walking again. "I mean, the other undead get more respect than we do."

"Well, to be fair, I haven't had much contact with other animated skeletons, so I really wouldn't know," said Susan.

"I think it's because we're humans whose flesh has been stripped away," said Skelly. "That might be why humans are afraid of us."

"You might be onto something there," said Susan. "At least zombies have their skin."

"I thought about using flesh-toned clay once, along with a wig, but the issue was things like eyes and tongue, and what would I make those out of," said Skelly. "At least Golems have their enchantments."

"I don't think that I could put clay on my bones," said Susan. "The idea feels mucky to me."

Skelly chuckled. "You might have a point there."
14512341233.title: They keep on walking

1453.content:
Corporal Muck - Golem

Animated clay imbued with magic, the golem eventually known as Muck did a lot of the dirty jobs that people didn't want to do. One of these jobs was mucking out the stalls of its owner's valuable, and violent, horses. However, it seems that its owner fell afoul where the Tax Laws were concerned, and had said horses, and the golem itself, confiscated. Rutabaga found out about the golem, and requisitioned it from storage to act as a guard at the Jail House, as few could escape from a golem that had been given a Capture Order for very long. Eventually, a spell was found to give the golem Free Will, as well as other golems. Since its last job was mucking out stalls, the golem was called Muck. Muck was soon placed on Riot Duty, as well as Fire-Fighting duty, to say nothing about regular Patrol Duty.

Guard Gre - Lizardman

Gre is a lizard person. When it comes to lizard person biology, biology is rather tricky. In fact, it's advised to employers to hire males and females in equal numbers. This is because they have a unique survival trait, as a race. If the ratio of male to female isn't about equal, it is possible for the lizard's gender to change from male to female, and female to male, as well as the reverse. The process takes about three days. After that, the population increases. This occurs even if small groups of lizard people are out of touch with other members of their own kind for longer than a few weeks, which is why it is best for lizard people to travel with friends, so that when a Gender Change does occur, they are among friends who won't take advantage of their situation, too much. Gre was partnered with another lizard, Res, to whom the Gender Change did occur to. Luckily, they were friends, but it still resulted in a fertilized egg. Now Gre has to deal with becoming a father fairly soon, all while trying to protect the city.

Guard Kess - Snakeman

Kess is a snake person, with a humanoid upper body, and a snake lower body that is as thick as a human's body and over thirty feet long, and is extremely strong, although he tends to be gentle. In addition to his strength, he can also produce several types of venom, from ones that can either paralyze the target and/or put them to sleep, to those that can kill, some of which are rather painless, to those that are extremely painful. He is also very snake-like where his eating habits are concerned, although sapient prey is off the menu, for the most part.
1453.title: Other Guards

choices: After dropping the prisoner off, he gets an important task.
14533.content:
Kess suppressed a grimace of irritation as he filled out a page in a notebook. "So, this guy didn't show any Thieves' Guild badge as he robbed you?"

"He didn't," said a woman. "He brandished a knife, threatened to cut me if I didn't give him the money, and he jumped out the window after I gave it to him." She looked at the empty drawer. "I hope that I don't get into trouble with the Head Seamstress."

Kess forced a smile to his face, as he felt another irritation. "I doubt that you will. He was going to harm you if you didn't do as he said. I'm sure that your Head Mistress will understand."

"Are you alright?" the woman asked. "Looks like you're in a bit of pain."

"Roughly the same amount you'd feel after stubbing your toe," said Kess. "Seems our unlicensed thief's knife isn't as sharp as he likes, especially given the fact that I'm wearing mail armor down in that area. Still, give him some credit, he is trying to use a bit of force behind each blow, in an attempt to escape. One moment."

"Sure thing," the woman said.

Kess pulled his upper body out of the window he'd been looking through, and looked down at his lower body, where he had a man wrapped up in a couple of coils, pinning their legs together, along with one of the man's arms to their body. The other arm had a knife in its hand, and the unlicensed thief was trying to use it to stab Kess.

"Buddy, unless you wish for a Healer to treat you for more than just that broken leg from when you jumped out of the window, please quit with the stabbings," Kess said. "I can keep this up much longer than you can, and I can apply more than enough force to break your back, arm, and legs." To demonstrate his point, Kess tightened his coils just enough to cause pain to the unlicensed thief, causing them to scream. "Drop it." Reluctantly, the unlicensed thief let go of the knife. "Thank you."

Kess then went back into the window with his upper body. "Sorry about that. I think he got the message though."

"It was good that you were passing by when you were," said the woman.

"Yes," said Kess. "The Thieves' Guild would have loved to have used him an an example, and break every bone in his body, to show unlicensed thieves why stealing without a license is a bad idea. At least this way, he'll get healed up, and only have to do a few years hard labor, unless he has something else to stand for." He got out his notebook again. "By the way, for the Record, what is your name?"

"Rose H. Thorns," the woman said.

"Alright," said Kess, as he put the notebook away. "I will send for you if you are needed."

"Maybe you'll come by when you are off the clock," said Rose. "There's some things about your sort I'm curious about."

"Such as?"

"Just how good are you with those coils of yours?" said Rose.

Kess grinned in understanding. "I see. We'll have to find out later. But first, I'd better drop off my prisoner."
14533.title: Kess the Snake

choices: Kess has sex with Rose, being similar to a human in that regard.
Kess decides to give Rose a squeeze.
Kess settles for a massage, a full-body one.
Suddenly, a scream is heard along with the ringing of a bell! Trouble!
145333.content:
Some hours later, after signing off for the night, Kess had returned to the Seamstress' Guild, where he met up with the Head Seamstress.

"It was good of you to come when you did," the woman said. "Rose has been talking about how you caught that unlicensed thief who threatened her, and robbed me."

"It was nothing really," said Kess. "I was merely passing by when he jumped out of the window. I guess he misjudged the height, and broke his leg. Didn't really have to chase him. Of course, the fact that he had a knife out, kind of obvious about his intentions."

"Still, it was good of you to be where you were in order to capture him," said the woman. "If I caught him, well, I have devices that makes even the hardiest of my clientele beg for release rather quickly. Even the Head Torturer is impressed by some of them."

"Yes, but I expect that you tend to employ those devices with a safety system in place to make sure that no one is seriously injured," said Kess. "You don't want the Commander to shut the place down you know."

"Of course I do," the woman said. "Many are repeat customers."

"Are your employees into such things?" Kess asked.

The woman looked him over. "There's a few who don't mind being restrained. Rose is one of them."

"I guess that's good to know," said Kess.

"By the way, your visit is on the house," the woman said. "It's the least we can do."

"Alright," said Kess.

Kess then slithered his way towards Rose's room. As he did, he heard plenty of sounds of what was going on in the other rooms. It wasn't much of a secret as to what occurred at the Seamstress Guild, in a number of ways, although the name of being a Seamstress was much more polite than being called a Prostitute. Besides, some of them actually engaged in mending clothes while the client was busy. Also, there were other things that they did.

Soon enough, Kess entered Rose's room.

"I was wondering when you'd show up," she said.

"Had to fill out paperwork," said Kess.

"So, what do you want?" Rose asked.
145333.title: Later, Off-Duty with Rose

choices: They move on to the squeezing and sex
Suddenly they hear a scream followed by another, and ringing of bells - Trouble!
There's a commotion in one of the other rooms.
1453333.content:
"I think that I'll just have a nice full-body massage," said Kess, as he took his clothes off. "After all, There's a few things I'd have to work out, if I wanted to have sex with you, or if I wanted to give you a squeeze."

Rose chuckled. "I understand. You don't want to hurt me."

"Of course not," said Kess as he laid his human part on the bed. "Besides, I'd hate to be in the middle of something, only to hear a scream for help."

"You guards are never really off-duty, are you?" Rose asked, as she started rubbing his shoulders.

"Not exactly," said Kess, as he started to enjoy the feeling of Rose's hands on him.

"Maybe we can work something out," said Rose. "You wouldn't be the first snakeman I've had sex with, or been squeezed by. Sometimes I've even done both at the same time. I just enjoy that sensation of being held at someone's mercy."

Kess grinned. "Alright. I think I could go with that sort of thing."

Rose gave him a kiss. "I'm sure that you'll enjoy having a victim to toy with. I have a very high tolerance for pressure."

"How high?" Kess asked.

"So long as you don't break my bones or cut off my breathing, I'm good," said Rose. "Release Word is Vegetable."

"I'll keep it in mind," said Kess.
1453333.title: Kess settles for a massage, a full-body one.

14534.content:
Raynor Swiftrunner - Centaur

Raynor is a centaur who took a job as a guard because it paid quite well, and was much more consistent work than that of being a mercenary or a courier. Granted, it is often times boring, consisting mainly of breaking up the occasional squabble, checking incoming and outgoing caravans for contraband, and other such typical guard duties, at least it's a regular paycheck, which lets him buy the food he need, pay for his rent, and a few other things. While his humanoid half wears armor similar to that of a human, his horse half wears armor similar to that worn by a horse, including, much to his annoyance, something similar to a saddle, along with a set of reins attached to the armor on his torso. He puts up with them because sometimes it's necessary to transport an injured person, guard or citizen, to a healer, and there's always the possibility that someone might blind his eyes in some form or another while carrying someone, meaning he'd need to be guided himself. On his feet, he wears a special kind of boots that can be easily taken off, as he dislikes the idea of having shoes nailed to his hooves like those of a horse tend to be, but they'd still need to be protected anyways. That being said, he does have the ability to run quickly, which is useful when moving someone to another location, or when relaying orders, and can carry a great deal of weight, which is useful when the guards find themselves in some sort of standoff with a group of unlicensed criminals. To his own personal annoyance, some of his gear does require some assistance to put on, and take off.

Munis Stronghoof - Minotaur

Munus is a minotaur who took the job of being a guard in a city, mainly because he disliked the idea of guarding a cave filled with treasure for no real reason. At least, as a guard in a city, one made money and could actually talk to other people. He is very strong, and has a good sense of smell and hearing. He also has no issues in dark places.

Baked Beans - Enchanted Rat

Beans is a rat who once lived off of the trash that wizards tend to throw out. However, a miss-applied spell ended up making him sapient. However, he was still just a rat, and thus still had to deal with cats and rat catchers. Eventually making his way to the Guard Station, he built a nest in Commander Rutabaga's office, that is to say, under the floorboards under the Commander's desk. Here, he learned a lot about the law, and even came to respect the werewolf, who could smell him, yet could never catch him despite his best efforts to locate the rat. One day, the Commander was investigating the home of a serious unlicensed thief, when Beans, who had tagged along in the pack of another guard, unbeknownst to both of them, managed to locate a hidden switch that opened a hidden door, that revealed something far more serious than unlicensed theft, which got the criminal an appointment with the Hangman. Puzzled over the door suddenly opening, once the criminal was taken away, the Commander investigated further, and that was when Beans made his presence known. Recognizing the scent of the rat as the one that had been eluding him in his office, the Commander made the decision to hire the rat, and let him live under the floorboards in his office. While not much use in a standard patrol, or in a fight, for the most part, Beans has proved invaluable when it comes to investigating suspects' homes, and has even saved more than a few kidnapped, or captured, people by biting through their bindings, and leading them to freedom, or bringing help to them.
14534.title: Other Male Non-Human Guards

145344.content:
Zortork Cragspurn: A massive and powerfully built orc guard who is also a magic enthusiast despite his hulking muscular stature. Having grown up in the orc district of Big Fat Pig City he joined the guard in hopes of becoming a leader of his people.

Not only that, but he is aware of the his commander's "unofficial" legal claims to the throne. Yet he's fairly certain that the enigmatic Tyrant could be an orc. Besides humans, orcs tend to have a decent amount of say in the politics of Big Fat Pig City.

In fact the population of orcs has been growing thanks to the Tyrant. Yet Zortork wonders if any of Rubtabaga's kin would claim the throne as a puppet ruler for the Tyrant. Yet in the end it doesn't matter as he enjoys a great workout between shifts and some magical hijinks.

And those magical hijinks include the occasional magical makeover for Rutabaga, which often fails, and seeking out werebears so he can get ursathropy for reasons that only he knows.
145344.title: Other Male Non-Human Guards

15.content: So you're a woman and not human. Please specify your species and tell us your name.
15.title: Female Non-Human Guard

choices: The Empress of Shinara will invade Big Fat Pig City
The Lost King will be hunted to the ends of the earth
The people will revolt against the Tyrant. They'll take over the town in secret.
151.content:
Jane Wylde, one of Commander Rutabaga's guards who worked the night shift and sometimes the day shift. She was currently out on patrol until she heard a scream.

"Noooo! By the name of the Goddess stay back!" a woman screamed.

"Sounds like trouble. Better get there before the boss does. I can't have my boss outperforming me now can I."

Jane runs off in the direction of the scream. When she arrives she sees a woman clothed in white backing away from a demon.

"Give up oracle. Your God or Goddess can't save you now," the demon said as he conjured a spear with his dark magic.

"Help!"

You don't see this every night. Looks like I arrived on time. Time to banish big, tall, dark, and ugly and save the oracle.

"Hey ugly! Step away from the oracle!"

The demon turns his gaze from the oracle and spots Jane who just turned into her wolf form. "Pfft, a werewolf. You think you can stop me!"

"I don't think I can. I know that I can," Jane said.

"Prepare to die, wolf," the demon said.

Before the demon could strike, Jane quickly hacks him with her sword and chops off his head.

"That should do it. You should be safe now."

"Thank you," the oracle replied.

Jane looks around to see if anyone else was pursuing the oracle before changing back into human form.

"What is an oracle like you doing out in the middle of the night?"

"I'm here to prophesy about the future of Big Fat Pig City. Several months from now...
151.title: Jane Wylde the Werewolf

choices: Let's do something romantic. Our shifts are over in five minutes anyway.
I have to ask you something
1513.content:
"I'm here to prophesy about the future of Big Fat Pig City. Several months from now the people will revolt against the Tyrant. They'll take over the town in secret," the oracle said.

Jane scratched her head in confusion. "A secret rebellion? Sorry oracle, but my boss won't let that happen. He'll order me and my fellow guards to quash the rebellion before it starts," Jane said.

"That would be true, but my vision tells me that he would fail to stop the rebellion because he will be out of town working escorting the Tyrant on a mission. It is up to you Jane Wylde to find out who is going to start the rebellion. Feel free to tell your boss, but remember he'll put you in charge of dispatching the rebels with some of your guards."

After the oracle had finished speaking a bright light envelops her body. Within minutes she disappears and the light fades.

"That was strange. I should definitely tell Commander Rutabaga about this."

"Tell Commander Rutabaga what?" A deep masculine voice asked.

Jane turned around and saw Rutabaga's younger brother, Beet Wolfgang Copperfinderson standing behind her. Beet is a tall and hairy man with red hair. He usually prefers to be called Wolfgang or Wolf as he is not very fond of his first name.

"Greetings Sergeant Wolfgang. I just saved an oracle from a demon. Then she told me about her prophecy of the townspeople planning a secret revolt against the Tyrant."

"Is that so? We'll definitely warn Rutabaga. After that we should see which of the nobles would be trying to stage this coupe," Wolfgang said. "In the meantime..."
1513.title: Warning of the Secret Rebellion

choices: Drazilla becomes Copperfindersson's  right hand woman
Copperfindersson finds out about her lineage and begins to woo her.
153.content:
Drazilla of the dragonborne had just been recruited to the force in Big Fat Pig City. Vacationing in the city, she was approached by one of the senior guardsman. He'd talked up the advantages of joining him so smoothly, Drazilla found she couldn't and didn't want to resist the idea.

Strong, tall and only slightly scaled, she managed to keep her wings concealed in their special skin folds for the most part. She had no need of the usual armor for her own skin was much better than it. Her hide could change with her surroundings if desired. Invisibility was also an option.

She used the dragonborne style of combat and thus was never defeated. While on patrol with her unit, she ran into Copperfindersson, their fearless leader. He seemed to be dazzled by her and often showed up where she was.

She had heard all the rumors about the leader and how he did not want a kingship because he would have to wed a boring princess. This made her smile, because he seemed not to know that there were all kinds of princesses. Keeping to herself her royal bloodline was easy, for no one seemed to believe the dragonborne had such a thing.

She knew what they thought, that her race were too savage and uncivilized to have a royal house. Well, all the better to lead a warrior's life in Big Fat Pig. She tried not to repeat the city's name too often, because it made her salivate for bacon, so in her head, she called it BFPC.
153.title: Drazilla the dragonborne

choices: Suddenly they hear a scream followed by another, and ringing of bells - Trouble!
The Commander mentions a Dinner he knows about.
1533.content:
One day, Drazilla was walking down the street, when she saw Copperfindersson standing in an alleyway.

"Commander," she said. "Nice to see you."

"Good to see you as well," the Commander said. "Walk with me."

"Yes sir." She fell in step with him.

"Dragonborne, right?" the Commander asked.

"Yes," Drazilla said. "You can tell?"

The Commander tapped his nose. "This knows. You wouldn't be the first one to hide something about their past, only to find out that I've found out about their secret."

"I suppose it would be hard to hide that from a werewolf," said Drazilla.

"It's not the only secret about you I've found out," said the Commander. "Tell your father that the Tyrant looks forward to his visit to the city. He says he's going to enjoy showing the King of the Dragonborne what the place looks like."

Drazilla blinked. "How did you know about my father?"

"Ask the Tyrant that one," said the Commander. "I don't care about your previous status outside of the city. A guard is a guard is a guard."
1533.title: Shocking Revelation

choices: Suddenly a scream is heard, and another, and the Ringing of a Bell - Trouble!
154.content:
Christine lapped up the blood as it came from her victim's shoulder. She enjoyed the flavor of not only the blood, but the salty sweat on the victim's skin. She moaned in pleasure, not from the taste, but because having a meal wasn't the only thing her victim was giving to her. She licked her lips, and looked her victim in the eyes.

"I hope you're not having trouble down there," she said.

Her victim chuckled. "It's not the first time I've done it one-handed."

Christina smiled with pleasure. "You've got magical fingers." She then gave her victim a kiss on the lips.

"I'm not a witch, but I'm a very good seamstress," the victim said, after the kiss.

"I'm just glad you have no problems accommodating a fellow woman's sexual needs," said Christina. "Some people are not so understanding."

The seamstress chuckled. "Sex is my business. If I couldn't have an open mind about the job, I wouldn't make any money."

"And I wager that you make plenty of money." Christina resumed lapping up the woman's blood.

"Enough to pay taxes," the seamstress said. "Speaking of paying-"

"Don't forget the discount," said Christina.

"I wouldn't forget that sort of thing," the seamstress said. "But next time, the price might be higher; there's been a lot of talk about how taxes are going to go up."

"There is some truth to that," said Christine. "But, as the Commander has told me, the tax increase is to help build the road, and make sure that it stays in good shape, so that the traders will have an easier time getting here, along with their goods, which will lead to more money for everyone, to say nothing about all of those lonely travelers who need a companion for the night."

"I can see where that would be useful," said the seamstress. "Another ten people a night, and the Head Mistress is planning to get some more affluent beds for our wealthier clientele."

"Even they get lonely," said Christine, as she lapped the shoulder, again.



A while later, Christine bandaged the woman's shoulder with some light gauze. "It should heal, within a few days."

"I hope so," said the seamstress. "Most people are turned off by the sight of a bandage."

"I like the system the Tyrant has set up for folks like me," said Christine. "Things are far more convenient than what they could be."

"I don't blame you," the seamstress said. "Half a cup here, half a cup there, and another eight half cups, and you've gotten your dietary requirements. Then, in another six months, you can feed off of the same ones."

"So long as you don't let someone else feed off of you," said Christine. "Although, you'd probably be safe to feed off of within two months, but one doesn't want to antagonize the Monster Slayers Guild too much, and no one wants to piss off the Commander."

"Now there's someone I wouldn't mind getting licked by," the seamstress said. "I wonder how long his tongue is when he's in his wolf form."

Christina chuckled. She then gave the woman a kiss, as she slipped a coin on the stand next to the bed. "Until later."

She walked over to the open window, and within the blink of an eye, changed from a lovely woman, into a furry bat with leathery wings. She then flew out the window.
154.title: Christine Walatblud the vampire

155.content:
Vivian the Vixen - Vivian is one of the Foxfolk. Lacking the extra tails of their Kitsune cousins, Foxfolk lack some of their kin's more famous abilities, including shapeshifting. Still, they are good at other things, including, but not limited to, stealth, persuasion, agility, and then there's the fact that they have claws and a wicked set of teeth if one should cross them. Vivian joined the force as part of the Illegal Vice Squad, often going undercover as a non-Guild Seamstress. Her usual tact is to ask would-be clients if they are sure that they want her, and not someone from the Guild. Of course, once she's given the person's money, that's when she slams them up against the wall, turns them around, and restrains them long enough for another undercover guard to come over and tie up the would-be client for the charge of Solicitation of a Non-Guild Seamstress - and the would-be client is lucky when they catch them in the act - Head Seamstresses have been known to disfigure/castrate those engaged in such things.

Mau the Catlady - Mau is one of the Catfolk. Graceful, seductive, and a very good listener, Mau specializes in Nobel and Wealthy criminals, often going with Rutabaga, in the guise of a Lady of the Night, when he's forced to mingle with the Rich and Powerful. However, far from being his dinner date, her position is such that she is able to listen to these unsuspecting, and high ranked, criminals, as they talk about their various plans to either overthrow the Tyrant, smuggle in illegal goods, or brag about what they did to some lowly peasant. Once she gets enough information, she lets Rutabaga, or whichever high-ranked Guard she's with, know what's up, at which point, arrests can be made.

Dawn the Drow - Dawn works the Night Shift. It's a position she's suited to, as working during the day causes her issues, unless wearing a wide-brimmed hat. That being said, she's very quick, her night vision is fantastic, has very good aim, and can throw a mean punch. More than one night-time criminal has been brought down by her.

Tracy the Turtle - Tracy often works the River Patrol. Capable of hiding herself in the murky waters of Big Fat Pig River, her job is to keep track of the various boats and ships, coming and going, looking for those that act a little too suspicious or too unsuspicious, checking for illegal smuggling or fishing, and other such waterborne crimes.
155.title: other Non-human Female Guards

choices: "Weapons and such." (The captain is a Licensed Smuggler)
"Rare and exotic plants for medicines." (Licensed Smuggler)
"Refugees from a war-torn nation." (Licensed Smuggler/Rescue Mission)
1554.content:
"T U R T L E Power," Tracy hummed to herself, as she swam in the river. "Hero in a halfshell.... something something"

"Mind your shell," said a voice.

Tracy looked, and saw how close she was to a "fishing" boat. "Sorry. Got a song stuck in my head."

"Know the feeling," said the boat captain. "Got one of those pirate songs stuck in my head. That 'Shiver My Timbers' one, the one with 'Dead men tell no tales' and that sort of nonsense. Kind of stupid. I mean, if dead men told no tales, then how come there's undead who like to talk the time away?"

"So, what are you hauling this time?" Tracy asked.

"Stripers, on ice," the captain said.

"Really?" Tracy asked. "Mind letting me come aboard?"

"What for?" the captain asked.

Tracy showed her Guard amulet. "Just doing my duty."

"Ah," the captain said. "Understood." He turned his head. "Lower a ladder for the Inspector!"

A ladder was lowered, and Tracy climbed up it. "Thank you for your cooperation."

"Sure thing," the captain said. "Pays to help the River Patrol."

"Your cargo?" Tracy asked.

"This way," the captain said.

Soon enough, Tracy was in the hold, with the captain, looking at the striped fish, which were all on ice. Tracy looked at the captain. "Alright, now that we're out of earshot of the rest of the harbor, what's the real cargo?"
1554.title: Turtle Power

info.brief_description: The life and times of serving in the City Guard in a Fantasy World. 1,700+ Views
info.description:
The Life Expectancy of the average guard in most works of Fiction is about 30 seconds after meeting the Hero. No one thinks anything of them. This Interactive is dedicated to those fine men, among others, including the great Fantasy authors, who created their own worlds.

Bowlworld – it is a world in the form of a very large bowl, sitting in the middle of a disk-like object, which could be mistaken for a giant’s tabletop. Imagine a bowl of cereal, with large chunks of cereal, and plenty of milk. Now, substitute the milk for water, and the cereal for large islands, continents, and you got Bowlworld. Don’t ask where the spoon is, for there is no spoon. Also, imagine that the sugar that you sprinkled on top of the cereal is where various towns and cities are located. One of those sugar crystals is Big Fat Pig City, one of the largest cities on Bowlworld.

The origins of Big Fat Pig City has been lost to history. Were the original inhabitants refugees fleeing from war? Did someone decide that they hated carrying around a smelly tent all of the time, and decide to settle down? Or, more likely, did a wagon wheel hit a rock, breaking it, causing the owner of the wagon to kick the rock, only to break his foot, and cause everyone to have to wait until the man’s injury healed and the wagon wheel was fixed?

The origins of the name are better known, and have been recorded as thus: The Leader of the Wandering tribe came before the Farmer and said thusly, “That is one Big Fat Pig. Give him to me, and I shall let you marry one of my daughters.” The Farmer and his Wife were married for fifty years, and had twenty children, one of which became King of the City, exactly how is happened is filled with bloodstains (although it is unknown if this is the actual blood of his rivals, or if the writer cut his finger and bled all over the paper) and the city was renamed Big Fat Pig, in honor of his grandsire’s prophetic words.

Of course, in time, the King’s bloodline weakened, Civil War came, and the then-King was beheaded by the Commander of the Guards, who was the leader of the Rebellion. He too was eventually beheaded. That being said, no Kings ever retook the throne, and these days, Big Fat Pig City is ruled by a Tyrant, who is, mostly, a Tyrant in name only, as he rarely terrorizes the average citizen, as long as they pay their taxes. As for those who fail to pay their taxes, or those who are not average citizens, well, it is well-known that the Tyrant went to the Assassin’s Guild and graduated at the top of his class, but it’s just a rumor that he kills people himself – that’s what legally hired Assassins are for.

As for the City itself, it’s mostly ruled by Guilds – the Butchers, Bakers, Candlestick-makers, Fools, Pest Exterminators, Beggars, Assassins, Thieves, Seamstresses (aka Ladies of Negotiable Affection), among others – who control most of the day-to-day operations of the city.

Then, there’s the City Guard. After a number of Civil Wars, and the like, to say nothing of the legalization of the Thieves Guild – who were entitled to steal a set amount from people and businesses in return for cracking down on unlicensed thievery – as well as the Assassins Guild – who could only be hired to kill those who could defend themselves, or had the means of hiring the means of defending themselves, and had to leave a note after a legal job – the Guard was reduced to hiring those no one else wanted to work for them, and even that number reduced after a while. This changed after Turnip, a human raised by dwarves, joined the force, and set up improving the Guard.

Now, while the City Guard will still hire refuse from the streets, said refuse is honed and formed into an efficient force. The City Guard also looks past the fact that applicants are not always human – over a third of the force is comprised of dwarves, trolls, werewolves, vampires, intelligent zombies, gnomes, and other non-human races. In fact, the current Commander of the Guards, Rutabaga Blackfur Copperfindersson is not a full human – he’s half werewolf and half dwarf-raised-human, as Turnip ended up taking a female werewolf as a lover – The Guard being willing to look past the stereotype that women are the weaker sex, as they’ve found out that females will catch male criminals off-guard nine times out of ten, although criminals also use this trick, which is why there is always one female guard in every group out on patrol. As to how his mother, Vivian Goldenfur von Stoon, and his father became lovers, well, that’s a story in and of itself, but it involved a hostage situation, and, after it was resolved, well, there was a bed in the room – the real question is Who was the Hostage, and Who did the Rescuing? Romantics claim that Turnip saved Vivian from a Werewolf-Hater, Werewolves claim that Vivian saved Turnip from a renegade Vampire, while Guards claim that an unlicensed thief found out that angering Vivian over her wearing men’s clothing was a bad idea, and thus, while being questioned by Turnip, confessed to a number of small crimes that had occurred over the previous month, in order for Turnip to ask Vivian to let go of the thief’s feet, after which, the thief fell into a pile of horse dung. In any case, Vivian got pregnant, and Turnip was the father.

In time, Rutabaga Blackfur Copperfindersson became a guard, just like his parents, and eventually became the Commander. Thus, he makes life difficult for the Wealthy and Nobility, who like to think that they are above the Law. As such, he is the target of constant assassination attempts, both by Licensed and Unlicensed assassins. Licensed Assassins survive their attempts, but end up with at least a broken arm or leg, although female Assassins get an even worse punishment and are glad that they wear black to every event (especially their own weddings). Unlicensed thugs end up getting not only both of their arms and legs broke, they also end up going to the Tanty, and, depending upon what all else they’ve done, might end up paying a visit to the Hangman, who is very good at his job, and has never had any complaints from his visitors.

Copperfindersson is also very protective of the guards under his command; should an inexperienced guard wander into the wrong part of town, the worst they’ll suffer, usually, is being robbed of what they had on them – gear, armor, weapons, snack rations, cigarettes, money, that secret stash they thought had been hidden from the commander under their helmet – and maybe having some black and blue bruises, and the occasional broken arm, leg, or toes and fingers. That being said, they are usually left alive. Anyone foolish enough to kill a Guard soon finds out the hard way, as Copperfindersson will pay the killer a personal visit, and, if the killer is foolish enough to resist arrest, Copperfindersson will “defend himself”, meaning that the killer will be very lucky to not be too badly bruised, and thus cheating the Hangman of a visitor.

However, this is nothing compared to Copperfindersson’s biggest secret; through his father’s bloodline, he is the rightful heir to the Big Fat Pig City throne – it is a secret that is so-well kept, that everyone in the city has heard about it, and immediately dismissed it. After all, rightful heirs to thrones don’t remain in the Guards, they carry really big swords, which Copperfindersson has, they go right into the Palace, which he has, and they demand what they want and get it, which he has – pay raises for the guards, better benefits for them, and a new dartboard – and he always gets what he wants.

In fact, the Tyrant has asked Copperfindersson the reason why the werewolf/dwarf-raised-human has remained in the Guards and not become King, and this is the reason: If I were the King, then I would be forced to marry a Princess, and I find them to be very dull. I’d rather spend my time with a Seamstress, as they are more fun, and leave when I pay them.

Rules:
1. This is a Pseudo- Medieval/Renaissance Era Fantasy, with lots of fantastic, mystical, and mythical creatures.
2. Rutabaga Blackfur Copperfindersson is the Commander of the Guard, but fill in the rank-and-file yourself.
3. Spelling and Grammar are a must.
4. Third Person is preferred.
5. While fetishes can pop up, the stories are to revolve around a plot of some sort, not a fetish.
6. Most anything else goes – I’ll think upon any changes later.
